loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married mother of ten children, Gilda works hard to support her family.

She has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from food vending. Gilda is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her mat weaving.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her mat weaving.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 45 years old and married, wth eight children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jean has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. Jean has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

Jean has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Jean would like to save money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

loans.name: Palomas (Flat) Group

texts.es:
Palomas (Flat) es el nombre de un pequeño grupo integrado por 4 mujeres alegres y emprendedoras, cada una de ella desarrolla una actividad económica con el propósito de mejorar su calidad de vida. Este grupo se encuentra ubicado en una región pesquera ya que a las orillas de la comunidad se encuentra la laguna de Temaxcal la cual brinda empleo a muchas persona con la pesca. 

Rosalia es una de los integrantes de dicho grupo, ella tiene la edad de 44 años, solo estudio la secundaria y está casada con Miguel que trabaja como albañil, ellos tuvieron una hija la cual ya es mayor de edad y trabaja.

Rosalia platica que siempre le ha gustado trabajar pero fue hace ocho años cuando con el apoyo de su familia inicio a vender calzado y ganar su propio dinero y contribuir con los gastos de su hogar.

Ella realiza sus ventas desde su hogar tiene un pequeño corredor en el cual coloca una vitrina en la que exhibe sus zapatos y sus amigos, clientes y vecinos acuden hacerle el gasto.

Un credito de VisionFund le ayudará ha invertir en la compra de variedad de calzado para continuar con sus ventas.

Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere y sus ganancias aumenten para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 

Los demás intregrantes del grupo son: Martha venta de tamales, Zeferina taller mecanico, Ana maria venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Palomas (Flat) is the name of a small group of happy and enterprising women. Each of them partakes in a business activity to improve their quality of life. They are located in a fishing region as the edge of their community meets Temaxcal Lagoon. Fishing is the source of employment for many locals.

Rosalia is one of the members. She is 44 years old, married to Miguel and has one adult daughter who works. Miguel works as a bricklayer. Rosalia recounts that she always enjoyed work. It was eight years ago that with the support of her family she started to sell shoes, make her own money and contribute to the household expenses. She sells from her house in a little corridor where they covered a window to display the shoes to her friends, clients and neighbors who come to buy.

 Rosalia will use this loan from VisionFund to help her buy a variety of shoes to continue with her sales. She hopes that with this investment her business will prosper and her profit increase so she can offer a higher standard of living to her family.

The other members of the group are: Martha who sell tamales, Zeferina has a mechanic shop and Ana Maria sells clothing.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes.

loans.name: Daisyvel

texts.en:
Daisyvel is studying at Stella Maris College. She is in her third year of her Business Administration program. Her father earns a living with his fish vending venture. Her parents have three dependents and their income is good enough for their basic needs. 

Daisyvel never stops dreaming. In order to continue school, she joined Gata Daku MPC and took advantage of its student loan products and services that support students' financial needs. She borrowed 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to cover the costs of the school tuition fees on her BSBA-3 first semester. She hopes to improve her ability to overcome obstacles and pursue her ambition.

loans.use: to cover the costs of the school tuition fees on her first semester of BSBA-3.

loans.name: El Bendito Group

texts.es:
Doña Guillermina es una mujer de 62 años que se ha dedicado al comercio por mas de 10 años, ella platica que durante este tiempo ha desempeñado diferentes actividades, pero actualmentes se dedica a la venta de ventiladores, perfumeria y brinda el servicio de foto copias. Las ventas de ventiladore y perfumes las realiza con sus amigos y vecinos de su comunidad casa por casa; el servicio de copias, desde su hogar. Ella hace sus ventas con e objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una fuente de empleo ya que es viuda y sus hijos aunque viven en la misma comunidad ya estan casados. 

Un credito de VisionFund le ayudara a comprar ventiladores, tintas, hojas blancas y variedad de perfumería para continuar con sus ventas. Ella desea que con este negocio su negocio prospere y sus ganancias aumenten ya que le gustaria hacer algunas mejoras a su hogar. 

Doña Guillermina es una de los integrantes de un grupo llamado "El Bendito", el cual se encuentra ubicado en la comunidad de El Jicaro en el cual las principales actividades economicas son el cuultivo de caña de azucar  y la ganaderia.

Los demas integrantes del grupo son:Victoriano venta de abarrotes y papeleria, Fernando carniceria y Aldo venta de antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
Guillermina is a woman of 62 years who has worked in business for more than 10 years. She says that during this time she has worked in various activities, but currently she is selling fans, and perfumes, and offers a photocopying service. The sale of fans and perfumes is done among her friends and neighbors from door to door. The photocopying is done from her home. She works with the objective of improving her quality of life and to have a source of employment as she is a widow although her children live in the same community and are married.

A loan from VisionFund will help her buy fans, inks, photocopying paper, and a variety of perfumes to continue her sales. She hopes that this business prospers and her earnings increase as she would like to make some improvements to the house.

Guillermina is one of the members of a group called “El Bendito” which is located in the community of El Jicaro where the main economic activities are growing sugar cane and livestock. 

The other members of the group are: Victoriano who sells groceries and stationery, Fernando who is a butcher, and Aldo who sells Mexican snacks.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, ink cartridges, photocopy sheets, and fans

loans.name: Iyubake Group

texts.fr:
Pétrone  fait partie du groupe  Iyubake  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 42 ans et mariée à Anaclet, un agriculteur. Ensemble ils ont 7enfants âgés de 6 à 20 ans, dont 6 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de farine de manioc et de maïs depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est à son  douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  son capitale et acheter   une grande quantité de manioc sec à transformer en farine,  à revendre pour de  gagner plus.
texts.en:
Pétrone is part of the group Iyubake and lives in Gitega. She is 42 years old and married to Anaclet, a farmer. Together they have seven children, from 6 to 20 years old. Six of the children are students.

Pétrone has been doing commerce in cassava flour and cornmeal for three years. 

She is on her 12th loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of dried cassava to process into flour, so as to earn more from her sales.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of dried cassava to process into flour, so as to earn more

loans.name: Jovena

texts.en:
As the married mother of six children, Jovena works hard to support her family.

She has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from rice retailing. Jovena is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her mat weaving.

Jovena has sustained her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her mat-weaving business.

loans.name: Adama's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc village a été créé le 22 Avril  2007,  il regroupe des femmes qui partagent des liens de solidarité du fait de leur compagnonnage pendant plus de cinq bonnes années. Les membres sont désireux de développer des activités génératrices de revenus ainsi améliorer les conditions d’existence facilitant l’accès aux produits de consommation. Ces femmes ont comme activité principale le petit commerce, elles pratiquent aussi la culture hivernale.

Madame Adama (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est la représentante du groupe. Elle âgée de 33 ans, est mariée et mère de trois  enfants dont un  garçon. Elle s’active dans la vente de produits alimentaires qu’elle achète dans le marché communal pour alimenter son étale au village. 

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte acheter : un sac de sucre de 50 kilos, deux à trois cartons de thé et divers autres produits alimentaires. 

Les bénéfices qui découleront de ces activités lui permettront d’augmenter son épargne et d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
This 'banc villageois' was created on April 22, 2007. It is composed of women sharing a solidarity out of their companionship for over five good years. The members would like to develop their revenue-generating businesses and thus improve their living conditions and to facilitate their access to consumer products. The main work of these women involves small-scale commerce. They also grow crops during the rainy season.

Ms. Adama, (sitting at the far right with her hand raised) is the group's representative. She is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children, including one boy. She is active in selling grocery items that she purchases at the communal market to supply her stall in the village.

With this new loan, she intends to purchase: a 50-kg sack of sugar, 2 or 3 boxes of tea, and a variety of other grocery items. 

The profits from her work will enable her to increase her savings and to help her husband to meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, tea, and various other grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ludgarda

texts.es: Ludgarda, de 58 años, es madre soltera y vive en su casa propia construida con gran amplitud para albergar a 6 de sus 12 hijos y sus nietos. Ludgarda se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano de distintos modelos, tamaños y colores. De manera periódica realiza la compra de su mercadería la misma que pone a la venta progresivamente a los habitantes de los pueblos ribereños hasta donde se traslada por cortas temporadas hasta culminar la venta de todo lo que lleva. Trabaja sola en este rubro desde hace 15 años. Complementa esta función con la venta de productos orgánicos como miel de abeja, cortezas y resinas curativas.  Le agrada mucho trabajar vendiendo prendas de vestir porque le permite conocer nuevos clientes y generar sus propios ingresos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará un lote de prendas de vestir conformada por polos, jeans, pantalones, blusas, camisas y shorts para ponerlos a la venta entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ludgarda, 58, is a single mother. She lives in her own home built with space for 6 of her 12 children and her grandchildren. Ludgarda works by selling second-hand clothes of different styles, sizes, and colors. Periodically, she purchases the merchandise that she then sells to the habitants of the coastal towns, moving for short stays until she finishes selling everything she brought. She has worked alone in this endeavor for 15 years. She compliments this work by selling organic products such as honey, bark, and healing resin from bees.

She attracts a lot of work by selling outfits because it allows her to meet new customers and generate her own income. At this time, she is requesting 2,000 soles. She is very grateful for this loan opportunity and for the financial support she needs to move forward. In addition, she promises to make her monthly payments punctually. With the amount requested, she will buy a bunch of of outfits including polos, jeans, pants, blouses, shirts, and shorts to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Cañaveral (Flat) Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad del Jobo existe un pequeño grupo integrado por 4 mujeres emprendedoras: Emilia servicio de taxi, Selene venta de productos naturistas, Lucina venta de cosmeticos, Elodia venta de antojitos. En esta comunidad la principal fuente de empleo se encuentra en el campo en la siembra y cultivo de caña de azucar. 

Doña Emilia tiene la edad de 43 años, solo estudio la preparatoria y está casada con el señor Agustín con el cual tiene un hijo, ella platica que por más de 7 años se han dedicado a brindar el servio de taxi ya que para llegar a su comunidad es un poco dificil ya que hay poco transporte, entonces algunas personas de la comunidad se detienen a la orrilla de la comunidad con sus coches y fungen como taxis colectivos. Ella comenta que tambien hacen viajes especiales cuando sus clientes lo requieren. 

Un credito de VisionFund le ayudará a comprar refacciones y dar mantenimiento a su taxi para continuar brindado este servicio. 

A Emilia le gustaría poder brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y que su hijo tenga oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
There exists a small group of enterprising woman in the community of Jobo. Emilia has a taxi service; Selene sells natural products; Lucina sells cosmetics; Elodia sells snacks. In this community the main source of employment is found in the fields, planting and growing sugar cane.

Emilia is 43 years old, is married with Agustín and they have one child. She only studied up to High School. Emilia says that she has had her taxi service for more than 7 years. It is difficult to get to the community as there is little transportation. So some people in the community stop on the outskirts of town and serve as collective taxis. She adds that she also makes special trips when her clients request it. 

The loan from VisionFund would help her buy parts and make repairs to her taxi so she can continue with this service. Emilia would like to offer her family a better quality of life and that her son has the opportunity to study to become a professional.

loans.use: to maintain a taxi.

loans.name: Kembang Kertas Group

texts.en:
The Kembang Kertas group received their new loan. The group had seven members and total loans of IDR 9.95 million. Each of them received about IDR 1.5 million. The loan was used to develop pig businesses where they lived.

Ni Nengah used her loans to purchase piglets and pig feed. She has a plan to sell them as a fattened pigs. Although the price for feed is quite high, Ni Nengah will handle that by giving the pigs a mixture of feed, made from various leaves and nutrious feed. She’s hoping that her plan will go well, and she can earn a satisfactory result. 

She has a dream of becoming a piglets seller in her village. She’s also hopes she can vecome independent in terms of business capital. Now she will save all the profits to make all of her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy superior piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Resilyn

texts.en:
Resilyn is 31 years old and married, with five children, three of them in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Resilyn has a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. Resilyn has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy raw materials for her mat weaving.

Resilyn has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Resilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her mat weaving.

loans.name: Islom

texts.ru:
Ислом житель района Шахритус. Ему 57 лет, имеет жену и взрослых детей. Ислом дехканин. Он занимается земледелием на небольшом участке земли. В его хозяйстве как и у многих сельских жителей имеются две коровы для нужд семьи. Сейчас Ислом хочет одновременно заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота, чтобы улучшить финансовое состояние семьи. Его стартовый капитал составляет 450 долларов. Он просит кредит чтобы приобрести 4-х голов бычков и телят. Ислом будет покупать бычков с рынка, в течении 30-35 дней будет их откармливать  и затем перепродавать на том же рынке. Так как рынок находится рядом с домом, у него не будут транспортных расходов.
 Ислом с юных лет отличался своим упорством и целеустремленностью. Он уверен, что этот кредит ему поможет и у него все получится.
texts.en: Islom is a resident of the region of Shahrituz. He is 57 and has a wife and adult children. Islom is a farmer and he works a small plot of land. As with many villagers, his property includes two cows for his family's needs. In addition to his current work, Islom now wants to buy and sell big-horned cattle in order to improve his family's financial situation. His starting capital is $450. He is requesting a loan to purchase four steers and calves. He will buy the steers at the market, fatten them for 30 to 35 days and then resell them at the same market. Since the market is located near his home, there will be no transportation expenses. Since he was young, Islom has stood out due to his persistence and purposefulness. He is sure that this loan will help him and that his business will be successful.

loans.use: to acquire four steers and calves to start a business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 74 years old and married with eight children.

Aurora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Aurora has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

Aurora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jesson

texts.en: Jesson is a 20-year-old student of Stella Maris College, studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. His father is a driver while his mother is engaged in snack vending to earn a living. In order to pay the school tuition fees on his first semester on BSBA in third year level, he borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC. He never allows any hindrances and difficulties to interrupt his ambition to get closer to his dream. He wants to got a job related to his course someday to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees on his first semester on BSBA-3

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is in her fourth year level studying Bachelor of Science in Business Administration at Stella Maris College. Her parents make a living as care takers. She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan to buy school supplies and materials like uniforms and books. Her ambition in life is her armor to fight hardship along her way. She never stops dreaming. She wants to make it possible to have a better living condition in the near future.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and materials like uniforms and books

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en: Manilyn is studying in Stella Maris College. She is 19 year old. Her parents make a living through business. She joined Gata Daku MPC and she gains access to all financial services and borrowed a loan of 10,000.00 PHP to pay the school tuition fees on her first semester. She wants to be a successful woman and has a passion to finish her course and be able to get a job in order to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fees on her first semester

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao was born in 1992. She lives in Bac Ninh province. She learns as an accounting major at Dai Nam University (http://www.dnu.edu.vn/index.php). Her course lasts 40 months, and she will be graduated in 2015. Her education fee is subsidized by her parents. Thao plans to find a part-time job to have much more money for paying her education fee. 

Thao’s family has five members. She is the first person in her family who has a higher education. Her parents grow rice to earn a living. Her mother had her photo taken with her in the posted photo. Her family’s income is about 5,000,000 VND (Vietnamese dong) per month. 

Thao has a passion for her major. She wants to follow through until the end of this university’s course. She understands that learning helps her have qualifications to get a high-paid job, bring income for her family and contribute a little part in the country’s development of economy. 

She wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay for her education fee. If she couldn’t access this loan, her studying must be interrupted. She appreciates the help of people all around the world who are raising funds for this kind of program. This has been very supportive to the education of students in Vietnam. She also hopes this program could be expanded more to help more students.

loans.use: to pay for her education’s fee.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She is 53 years old and married with two adult children. She and her husband have been farming vegetables for 20 years now. They farm string beans, eggplant, patola (sponge gourd), squash, okra and bottle gourd. 

She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide. She believes in her hard work coupled with the right capital to sustain her business. She hopes that someday, she can cultivate more land to increase her production.

Her income provides food for her and her husband and pays for other household necessities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticide.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. He is married with two children, ages four and six. Antonio relies on rice farming to support his family. He has been in this business for three years now, and he earns an average income of 2500 PHP every month. It is quite challenging for him to continue his business while also meeting the needs of his family. He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his rice field. 

Antonio hopes that someday he can open another business to support his children's education and expand his current business, too. He uses his income for school fees and family consumption.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice field.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Rubelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Rubelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

Rubelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

loans.name: Irfan

texts.en:
Irfan, 24, is a young and energetic man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has worked in this business for many years and earns a reasonable income for his family. Since his brother and sisters are young and his father has grown old and does not work, Irfan provides comfort to his parents and younger siblings.

He is a milkman, by profession. Irfan sells milk to his hometown and bull calves to the butcher. He has four cows and he milks twice a day. He delivers the milk to his customers and collects payment on a monthly basis. Irfan plans to add a buffalo to his herd because they can provide more milk than a cow. A buffalo is also more expensive and he does not have enough savings.

Irfan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to buy one buffalo to increase his milk production. He also wants to maintain his cowshed.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to increase milk production and sales.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida works hard to support seven children. She is married and has a pottery business in the Philippines.

Nida requested a PHP 4,600 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of brownouts.

Nida is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but also helping the environment and reducing health hazards for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma works hard to support her family. Alma is married and earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines.

Alma is borrowing PHP 4,600 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses.

Alma is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she helping the environment, and reducing hazardous risks for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily works hard to support two children. She is married and has a frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Lily requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Lily is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing risks to the health of her family.

loans.use: to buy solar lamp.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a widow with two children. She resides in Oroquieta City beside her children. She is engaged in snacks vending business to make a living. She cooks a variety of snacks and vends them in her neighborhood. 

She borrowed a loan from Gata Daku MPC which she had joined in 2011 to buy raw ingredients for her snacks for sale. 

An amount of 4,000 PHP will help her generate more income to be used for their living. She saves a portion of her generate revenue for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make snacks for sale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida lives in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, along with her family. She is married to a carpenter. She buys and sells copra, the dried kernel in coconuts, to make a living. She has been in this business for seven years. 

She has taken a loan of 10,000.00 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to buy more copra to sell. She joined GDMPC in 2008. Adelaida wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional copra to sell.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en: Melvin is 37 years old and married. He and his wife are blessed with two children. He has had a hog raising business for almost eight years. From this business he earns a net income of PHP 6,000 when he sells two hogs. Due to a lack of capital, he decided to ask for a loan amounting to PHP 33,000 to  purchase hogs and hog feed. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can improve his business to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase hogs and hog feed.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
Domingas is 30 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has two children She opened her second-hand clothing stall in 2000 with her own working capital of $90.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy more stock of some products to keep in her store such as shirts, shorts, and  pants. She is a very hard working woman and doing business has been her regular activity for the past 12 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people in order to improving their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy  shirts, shorts, pants, and bags.

loans.name: Domingas

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Domingas to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like vegetables, onions and garlic. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, onions and garlic.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is married with five children and resides in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, with her family. Her husband is a private employee and Nila runs a general store to make a living. 

She has borrowed 11,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to buy more canned goods and bottled products to sell in her store. She plans to use the additional money she earns to expand her business.  She wants to improve the general living condition of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods and bottled products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mryna

texts.en:
Myrna has operated a general store for 11 years in Talic, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is a 57-year-old widow with three children. 

In 2011, Mryna joined GDMPC.  Myrna successfully repaid her previous loans that were used in expanding her business. She is now requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase noodles, sardines and sugar. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as working capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, sardines and sugar to sell in her store

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en:
Rashad is 28 years old and married. For the past four years, he has a shop where he sells women's clothes at the local market. Rashad already has his clients and he makes profit every day, but the owner of the shop sometimes creates difficulties as he often spoils the contract. Rashad has to sign a new contract with new conditions.
 
He needs a loan to buy autumn clothes for his business. His business is the only source of family income and he plans to expand it. He and his wife live in a rented apartment. He needs to buy his own house and he is firm in the direction of his plans.

loans.use: to purchase autumn clothes for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wheat flour, margarine, eggs, soybeans, etc.

loans.name: Amrah

texts.en:
Amrah is a 40-year-old, married father of two beautiful children.  Amrah raises sheep and sells them for meat. He has been in this business for 12 years. He is a very hard-working person, because he wants to support his family without lacking financially.

Amrah keeps a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar for butchers and customers to purchase. People eat mutton in traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas and pilovs. 

Amrah has taken four previous loans and has a good loan history. He is asking for 2,000 AZN to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in the autumn. He is optimistic about this loan, because more people consume meat in the autumn due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep in order to sell more meat in autumn

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa was born in 1968. She is married and a mother of 4 and lives at a rented house. Her husband is a driver. Sanaa has been sewing and embroidering on women's dresses and children clothes for 4 years. She started her project as a hobby. Then she started selling her products to her friends and family. Now she needs to buy more sewing materials and to fix her sewing machine in order to raise her productivity and income to be able to support her husband with covering their children's needs, as he is getting a lower income. But she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and to fix her sewing machine.

loans.name: Kholoud

texts.en:
Kholoud is married and a mother to five children. Her husband is in the military. She has sold home products for five years. 

Kholoud has applied for a youth loan to buy new merchandise such as glasses, trays, plates, spoons and knives to sell. She is planning to open her own store in the future to increase her income and help her husband in covering their children needs.

loans.use: To buy glasses, trays, plates and cutlery to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 60-year-old married man. He has one daughter. Ali is a merchant. He sells household goods for the home.

He is a very hardworking man. He takes care of his family. Ali works the whole day. He has been in this field for twenty years. His neighbors were his first clients, then day by day he expanded his business and opened a large market. 

Now he needs a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy more household products because people often ask him for a good he doesn't have. 

This is his fifth loan and he awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more household products for his business.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Marianita resides in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental with her family. She is a widow and has five children. She runs a general merchandise, selling a variety of goods to make a living. In 2009, she joined Gata Daku MPC, and recently borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more plastic wares and slippers for sale. 

She hopes to gain more revenue to use for the expansion of her business. She wants to see her children successful and improve the general living condition of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic wares and slippers for sale.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro Jose mayor de edad casado con dos hijos aun menores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios del Norte del Departamento de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es propietario de una pequeña pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo para el hogar como:arroz, aceite, huevos, golosinas, azúcar, detergentes, shampoo, cremas,cepillos de dientes, pasta de dientes, pampers entre otros, el realiza sus compras a camiones distribuidores que entran en la zona compra al contado y vende al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera semanal y quincenalmente, uno de sus sueños es surtir bien el negocio y que mis hijos puedan estudiar hasta ser unos profesionales. el objetivo de este crédito es para compra de productos de consumo del hogar como también cosméticos, ropa entre otros, y así ofrecerles variedades de productos a sus clientes ya que en esta fechas su demanda siempre crece mas por acercarse las fiestas patrias
texts.en:
Pedro Jose is an older gentleman who is married and has two young children.  He is originally from one of the towns in the northern part of Department of Chinandega, which is in the western section of the country.  Pedro is the owner of a small grocery store where he offers consumer household products such as rice, oil, eggs, candy, sugar, detergents, shampoo, creams, toothbrushes, toothpaste, diapers, and other items.  

He buys his inventory from distribution trucks that come to his district.  Pedro purchases his inventory with cash and then sells the products for cash and credit.  He collects payments either weekly or every two weeks.  One of his dreams is to keep his business well-stocked so that his children can study and become professionals.  

The purpose of this loan is to buy consumer household products as well as cosmetics, clothing, and other items.  This will allow him to offer a variety of products to his customers.  Demand always grows more whenever the dates of the patron saint festivals draw near.

loans.use: to buy consumer household products, cosmetics, clothing, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 47-year-old widow. She has three kids. Tahira rents a store where she is selling food products. She has 10 years of experience in this field.

Tahira sells from Monday to Sunday to customers who visit her shop daily. The customers include her neighbors and friends, as her business is located near her house. From this business, her monthly profit is 150 AZN.

Tahira is requesting a loan of 1,800 AZN to buy more food products such as soft drinks, juices, bread, cookies, milk, eggs, cheese, water, beans, sugar and butter. With the support of this loan, she hopes to increase her inventory and thus the volume of her sales. 

She has a good credit history and this is her 7th loan. She hopes to get money to expand her business in the future. Tahira awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more food products such as soft drinks, juices, bread, cookies, milk, eggs, cheese, water, beans, sugar and butter.

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly is married and has three children. She is 58 years old and lives in Oroquieta City along with her family. 

To earn a living, her husband works as a seaman while Lilly operates their rice farm. She has been in this business for six years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and weeding maintenance.

Lilly has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC which she used to buy farm inputs. In the future, Lilly wants to make improvements to her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and weeding maintenance for her rice fields.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una mujer muy ocupada, pues tiene un restaurant desde hace varios años y también se dedica a la producción de café junto con su esposo Juan. El café que ellos producen es de calidad de exportación y lo entregan en su totalidad a la “Unión Regional” para que allí sea procesado. Hace algunos meses María sembró nueva planta de café en su finca pues tiene planeado en 2 años aumentar su producción. Para que todo salga conforme a lo planeado María solicita un crédito el cual utilizará para comprar fertilizantes y pagar a los trabajadores que contratará durante la época de cosecha, ya que son muchas labores las que hay que hacer en los terrenos. Con las ganancias que obtenga al final de la cosecha pagará el crédito y remodelará su restaurant.
texts.en:
María is a very busy woman.  She has a restaurant that she has managed for several years, but she also spends time producing coffee along with her husband Juan.  The coffee that they produce is of export quality and all of it is delivered to Union Regional de Huatusco for processing.  A few months ago, María planted a new crop of coffee on her farm.  She expects her production to increase within two years.  

So that everything goes according to plan, María is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers and to pay the workers who will be hired during the harvest season.  There are many tasks that need to be performed on her land.  With the profit she earns at the end of the harvest, María will be able to repay the loan and remodel her restaurant.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay her workers.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: La Sra. Gladys sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de ropa,  cuenta que le fue con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de ropa de temporada y variedad de productos,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería ropa por mayor de temporada  ya  que se carca la primavera época de calor y necesita renovar sus productos,  incremento sus ventas por esta época de frio y incrementar sus ganancias, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladys continues in the same business of selling clothes.  She says that her previous loan was used to buy seasonal clothing and a variety of products.  

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy seasonal clothing in bulk since the warm spring season is approaching and she needs to replace her inventory.  Her sales and her earnings this past winter season increased.  She is pleased and appreciative of this opportunity she has been given to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Rukiya is the age of 48. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family. She is the mother of two sons and three daughters. Both of her sons have gotten married and are living separately. She is living with her three daughters and spouse. Her husband has become old and weak; he does not financially support them as earlier. 

To manage her household expenses, she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at her home. Rukiya and two of her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years now; her younger daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work with her, and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Rukiya wants to buy a used Juki sewing machine for her so that she could contribute to the income.

Therefore, Rukiya requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her younger daughter also could do some tailoring work and could contribute to the monthly income. 

Rukiya wants to make some savings so that she could get arranged the marriage of her daughters.

loans.use: to buy a used Juki sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Oscar, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltero y vive en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortes. Anteriormente era empleado de una maquila y hace 2 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bloques de cemento para la construcción. El negocio lo tiene en su casa, sus clientes son de la misma zona quienes utilizan el bloque para sus construcciones.  El préstamo que solicita es por 25,000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar en la compra de materia prima como ser cemento y arena, para realizar la fabricación de los bloques y asi poder incrementar las ventas y las ganancias. Su objetivo es que el negocio crezca cada dia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 26 years old, single, and lives in the town of Villanueva, Cortes.  He was previously employed at a factory.  

For the past two years, he has been making and selling cinder blocks that are used in construction.  He operates his business at home.  His customers are from the same area and use the blocks in their construction projects.  

The loan he is requesting is in the amount of 25,000 HNL and will be used to buy raw materials, such as cement and sand, for making the blocks.  This will increase his sales and his earnings.  His goal is to grow his business each day.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand for making cinder blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy basic supplies and materials to make handicrafts from recycled items.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is the kind of person whom should be admired. He is workaholic and loves his animal-husbandry business. He is breeding cattle and growing vegetables and fruit on his land. He sells by using his own car. Habib has two children, a son and a daughter, who help him with his farm, which has a couple head of cattle and a small plot of land for livestock-breeding and crop production. 

Soon Habib's son is going to get married. He does not have the money to make a wedding party, and that is why he is asking for a loan of 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat), which he will use to make the wedding party for his son.

loans.use: To cover the wedding party expences of his son.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en: Khawla was born in 1969. She is married and has six children. Her husband is a retired man who works in a bakery. Khawla has been working in selling housewares and making baskets since three years ago. She started her project by trying to make a basket and put it for sale. Then she realized that starting such a project will be profitable to her. So she started selling housewares after that in order to raise her income and to support her husband in covering their children's needs. Now she needs new merchandise and materials to make more baskets, but she doesn't have money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise and materials to make more baskets.

loans.name: Cooperativa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COOPERATIVA”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Manuela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de deportivos, costura de chamarras, venta de fruta, compra y venta de corderos, trenzado de mantas, tienda de barrio, artesanía en mantas, venta de sogas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Manuela es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos y de ella misma de no contar con un lugar de compras cercano.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceite, enlatados y azúcar) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Cooperativa” will begin its eighth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Hub of Panamericana. It is composed of eight members and is led by a board of directors, where Manuela is the president. 

The businesses carried out by the members of the communal bank are varied; among them are: selling athletic equipment, sewing jackets, selling fruit, buying and selling lambs, weaving blankets, a neighborhood store, making traditional blankets, and selling ropes. 

The loan that they are taking out will benefit owners of small businesses like Manuela. She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago at the invitation of a promoter from the organization who came to visit her at her house. 

Currently, she has a neighborhood store. She started this business some years ago after observing her neighbors’ and her own needs and the lack of a nearby place to make purchases. 

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (purchase oil, canned goods, and sugar) that she will obtain from wholesale stores in the city of El Alto. Later, she will sell them in her sales stall. This kind of work allows her to generate income in order to maintain her home as much as possible, as she is married and has two children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the education on health and loans.

loans.use: to purchase oil, canned goods, and sugar.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de derecho, comenta que quiere terminar su carrera y poder ayudar a las personas.
Quiere también poder especializarse para poder seguir creciendo, ya que sabe que estudiando y fomentando sus conocimientos es la única forma de salir adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder usarlo en sus gastos de transportación y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte. Agradece por esta oportunidad de seguir estudiando que esta recibiendo, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Claudia is from the city of Carapeguá. She is studying law and mentions that she wants to finish her degree and be able to help others. Claudia also wants to to be able to specialize so that she can keep growing since she knows that studying and promoting her knowledge is the only way to get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan in order to pay her transportation expenses and for her classes. She is very grateful for this opportunity to continue studying. It will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to pay for classes and transportation.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Devotha, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children: two boys and one girl. All of them are still going to school. For three years now, she has been earning her living by running a grocery store. She works from 1 p.m. to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
  
This will be Devotha’s sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock missing drinks and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and saved the rest in a bank. She will use this loan to restock the missing drinks in her grocery store. She is doing great. She dreams of owning a hardware shop. 
  
Devotha will share this loan with her loan group, “Ulezi,” which has five members. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing drinks in her grocery store.

loans.name: Gabriel Ángel

texts.es:
Gabriel de 53 años, hombre dedicado al trabajo agrícola, vive con su compañera de vida, procrearon 7 hijos, de las cuales 2 ya son bachilleres y 2 aún estudian. Uno de sus hijos formó una familia a parte, los otros 2 emigraron asía Estados Unidos. 

Él se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, cuando su padre suyo le enseñó a trabajar la tierra, sembrando granos básicos. El lugar de trabajo le queda a medio kilómetro de su casa suya, y a 5 cuadras el otro.

Con el préstamo comprara los insumos que utilizará en la siembra de sorgo como: herbicidas, fertilizante y mano de obra.

Su sueño es ver a sus hijos estudiando, para que estudien una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Gabriel, age 53, is a dedicated man who works in agriculture.  He lives with his life companion and they have seven children.  Two of them have already completed high school and another two are still studying.  One child has a family and the remaining two moved to the United States.  

Gabriel has been farming since he was 12 years old.  His father taught him how to work the land.  He grows basic grains.  The place where he works is located a half kilometer from his house and consists of five plots of land.  

His loan will be used to buy supplies for his sorghum crop, such as herbicides and fertilizers.  He will also pay for labor.  His dream is to see his children studying so that they can pursue a university degree.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Elisa Lexania

texts.es: Elisa, actualmente tiene a su cargo a sus dos hijos y una hermana con capacidades diferente, ella trabaja como docente en una escuela. Solicita este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción como piedra cantera, arenilla, cemento con lo cual pretende iniciar la construcción de una pared en la parte trasera de su vivienda, este pequeño proyecto lo pretende llevar poco a poco debido a que tiene responsabilidades económicas como gastos de escuela, alimentación y cargos básicos del hogar. Esta pared en un futuro le servirá como anexo para cuartos que le permitirá un mejor espacio y mayor seguridad para sus hijos.
texts.en: Elisa presently has in her care her two children, and a sister with special needs.  She works as  a teacher in a school.  She is reqesting this loan to buy construction materials such as gravel, sand, and concrete, with which she will start the construction of a wall in the area behind her house. This smalI project will be worked on little by little due to her financial responsibilities such as school  food costs, and basic household itmes. This wall will serve in future as an annex for rooms that will allow her to provide more space and stability for her children .

loans.use: to buy concrete, iron, concrete block, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a widow with two children. She is engaged in trade. The scope of her activity is the sale of women's and children's clothing in the local market. For the past 13 years, Sakina has supported her children with the income from her work and without any relatives' help. 

Sakina's son is sick. The reason she has applied for a loan at this time is to pay for his treatment. If her son were healthy, at last she would feel herself the happy mother and would continue to work with healthy enthusiasm.

loans.use: to pay for her son's medical treatment.

loans.name: Azada

texts.en:
Azada is a 51-year–old, widowed woman. She has two kids. She lost her husband two months ago. Now she is the only person who can take care of her family.

She has land but she does not have enough funds to cultivate the land or grow fruit trees or vegetables. For that she needs a loan 1,800 AZN to buy fruit trees, seeds, and fertilizers. She has already taken three loans from Aqroinvest in the past. With a good loan history, she has applied for a fourth loan. Azada awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fruit trees, seeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal was born in 1972. She lives alone in a sector in Jordan called Zarqaa. Amal has been working in trading make up and perfumes for 5 years. She started her project with a small amount of money and found it a good source of income to support herself. So she is planning to expand her project. To do so, she needs to buy a larger quantity of makeup and perfumes. But she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy make up and perfumes to trade.

loans.name: Gulnoz

texts.ru: Гулноз 29-летняя жительница города Исфара. Она известна в кругах своим древним и востребованным ремеслом. Она шьет национальные рукоделия как курпа и курпача. Как вы видите на фотографии курпа и курпача - это матрасы из хлопка, которых таджики используют вместо дивана и кресел. Гулноз занимается данной деятельностью уже два года и так как ее деятельность расширилась ей помогает мать. Одновременно она занимается куплей и продажей полотенцев и скатертей. У Гулноз муж уехал на заработки в заграницу и находится там достаточно давно. Гулноз старается для своей пятилетней дочки и двухлетнего сына, чтобы обеспечивать их едой, одеждой и всем необходимым. Гулноз просит кредит для приобретения ниток, тканей и хлопка для продолжения своего дела. Она ждет вашей поддержки.
texts.en:
Gulnoz is a 29-year-old resident of Isfara.  She is renowned in certain circles for her ages-old, in-demand craft; she knits krupa and krupacha.  As seen in the photo, krupa and krupacha are cotton mats which Tajiks use in lieu of couches and chairs.  Gulnoz has been making these mats for 2 years, and as her business has grown, her mother has come to help her as well.  In tandem with her mat business, she also buys and sells towels and tablecloths.
  
Gulnoz' husband has gone abroad seeking work and has been away for some time already; she works hard to provide her 5-year-old daughter and 2-year-old son with food, clothing and all the necessities of daily life.  She is requesting a loan to purchase threads, fabrics and cotton for her business, and looks forward to your support.

loans.use: to purchase threads, fabrics, linings and cotton for her business

loans.name: Roth's Group

texts.en:
Roth, 27, is from a rural village in the Moungkul Borey district of Bateay Meanchey province. She is married with three children, all of whom are in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice while her husband also is a motor-taxi driver in the local area. Having been in this business for several years, Roth is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is Roth’s group microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund, and she is a first-time borrower. As the leader, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan, and she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to set aside some money to fulfill her dream of having a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Shain

texts.en:
Shain is 43 years old and grows and sells fruits and vegetables. He is a farmer and market vendor at the same time. Shain  is married and has two children. He has 6 years of experience in raising crops. He usually sells them from his yard and his shop. His monthly income is 120 AZN.
Raising crops takes a lot of strength and requires physical work, which is hard for one man so his wife helps him to grow crops and take them to the shop. He grows cucumbers, tomatoes, pears, potatoes, carrots, apples, cherries and onions.  

He applied for a 1,900 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of his land. This will be his 3rd loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer to improve the quality of his land.

loans.name: Heap's Group

texts.en:
Heap is aged 51 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and one son in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. She has been in rice farming and corn planting for 31 years while her husband is a fisherman. The current business earns her family about 26,000KHR per day to feed the family but she manages to save about 15,000KHR each day.

This is the fouth loan for Heap with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Heap, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una joven soñadora, con ansias de poder ser una buena profesional que ayude a quienes necesitan. Lucha por crecer y ser la mejor en lo que hace.
Ella quiere poder conseguir su licenciatura y poder trabajar en un instituto para poder ayudar a las personas que necesitan, y quiere ayudar a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases y así seguir estudiando, ya que le será de mucha ayuda. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Carolina is a young dreamer who is eager to become a successful professional who can help others in need.  She strives to grow and become the best at what she does.  

Carolina wants to obtain her degree and work at an institute that helps people in need.  She also wants to help her family.  Carolina is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her classes and continue studying.  This will be of great help and she is grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to pay for the classes needed to obtain her degree.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza  is applying for a loan of $ 1,000.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 30 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such oils, noodles, fish, cigarettes, sugar, coffee and slippers. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future.
 
Eliza is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: To buy oils, noodles, fish, cigarettes, sugar, coffee and slippers.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio vive con su hija en la casa de su Madre en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz. Se dedica a brindar servicio policial en nuestra ciudad. Julio necesita el crédito para poder culminar sus estudios superiores dentro de la institución castrense a la cual pertenece, poder acceder a grados superiores y cubrir con los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Julio es poder reunir el suficiente dinero para poder adquirir una vivienda propia y brindar mejor calidad de vida a sus allegados.
texts.en:
Julio lives with his daughter at his mother’s house in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.  He provides police services for the city.  

Julio needs this loan so that he can finish his studies at a law enforcement institution where he is enrolled.  This will enable him to access a higher education, which will give him the opportunity to provide for his household expenses.  

Julio dreams of earning a sufficient income so that he can acquire a house of his own and provide a better quality of life for his family members.

loans.use: to pay for his studies at the police academy.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: La familia de Juan José se ha dedicado a la cafeticultura por muchos años y él no es la excepción. Como la mayoría de los productores se inició desde pequeño trabajando con su padre y hermanos y cuando se casó con María y formaron una familia se independizó por completo. El café que Juan José produce es de la más alta calidad y lo entrega a la “Unión Regional” para que sea procesado y exportado. Para la siguiente cosecha necesita realizar algunas labores de limpieza en sus fincas, comprar fertilizantes y pagar a cortadores de café por lo que solicita un crédito para poder llevar a cabo sin ningún inconveniente todas estas actividades.
texts.en:
Juan José’s family has been involved in coffee production for many years and he is no exception.  Like most coffee producers, he started working at a young age with his father and siblings.  When he got married to María and started a family, he became completely independent.  

The coffee that Juan José produces is of the highest quality and is delivered to Union Regional de Huatusco for processing and export.  For the next harvest, he needs a few cleaning tasks performed on his farm.  He will also buy fertilizers and pay the coffee pruners.  For this reason, Juan José is requesting a loan so that he can accomplish all of these tasks without any problems.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers who will perform the cleaning and pruning tasks on his coffee farm.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 36 years old, married and the mother of two kids. She lives and runs her business in Agsu region. Susan rents a facility that serves as a grocery store. She sells food items, as well as household chemicals and other small items. Her husband helps her in this business. Susan's monthly income from this business is 130 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat).

Now she requested a loan of 1,900 AZN to purchase a batch of goods wholesale, i.e., tea, coffee, sugar, etc. This is her fourth loan from AqroInvest. One of her long-term plans is to purchase the facility she is renting at the moment and own it.

loans.use: to purchase a batch of goods wholesale, i.e., tea, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia sigue con la misma actividad de la venta material de escritorio, escolar en su librería,  cuenta que le fue con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de material escolar por mayor,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de material de escritorio para surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ganancias, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio ya que los créditos que saco con la institución siempre fueron para el incremento de capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia continues in the same business of selling writing materials and school supplies from her bookstore.  She says that her previous loan was used to buy school supplies in bulk.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan in order to buy writing materials so that she can restock her business and increase her earnings.  Sonia is pleased and grateful for the opportunity she has been given to grow her business.  The loans that have been issued by Emprender were always used to increase her operating capital.

loans.use: to buy writing materials to sell in her bookstore.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.en: Ayda was born in 1978. She is married and has one son. Ayda has been selling home products at a store in her house since seven years ago. She started her project by selling a small number of home products. She found it profitable, so she decided to expand it. Now she needs to buy a larger number of home products as it will raise her income, which will help her in covering her son’s needs, but she doesn't have enough money for them. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is married and has one child. He lives in his own house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. His potential customers are town dwellers. He cites the high cost of maintenance as being his major challenge.

With the 25,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to paint his motorcycle and also buy spare parts. He joined Yehu to access loans to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to paint his motorcycle and also buy spare parts.

loans.name: Virgilia De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Virgilia, tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos con quienes ella vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula.  Anteriormente vendía solo tortillas. Ella lleva 10 años de experiencia en su propio negocio, vende comidas como ser baleadas, tacos de pollo, almuerzos, pupusas etc. El préstamo que solicito es por 25,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de productos para la elaboración de las comidas como ser harina, condimentos, frijoles, pollos etc., y también para cancelar pequeña deuda con  un prestamista lo que le permitirá tener solvencia  y poder aumentar los ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Virgilia is 42 years old and a single mother.  She has three children who live with her in the town of San Pedro Sula.

Previously, she only sold tortillas.  Virgilia now has 10 years of experience in operating her own business.  She sells dishes such as “baleadas” (a Honduran version of a burrito), chicken tacos, lunches, “pupusas” (tortillas stuffed with various fillings), and other items.  

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 25,000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of products used in preparing her dishes such as flour, condiments, beans, chicken, and other items.  Virgilia will also pay off a small debt to a moneylender.  This will enable her to be solvent so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing her dishes and to pay off a small debt.

loans.name: Nueva Luz Ii Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Nueva Luz II” en la ciudad de Cusco. 
Natalia tiene 39 años de edad y tiene una relación unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, (En la fotografía la socia está levantando la mano). 

Natalia es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante pues su actividad económica principal es la venta de comida, ella en esta oportunidad Natalia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, verduras, sacos de arroz, fideos, aceite, carnes y otros más.   
 
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la venta de zapatos, zapatillas, comida, cosméticos, refrigerios, desayunos, ropa y huevos sancochados.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank “Nueva Luz II” (New Light II) in the city of Cusco.  Natalia is one of the members.  She is 39 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children.  In the photo, Natalia is the woman who has her hand raised.  

Natalia is a charismatic and friendly person who has been able to get ahead.  Her main business activity is selling food.  She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy supplies such as sacks of sugar, vegetables, sacks of rice, noodles, oil, meat, and other items.  

This Communal Bank consists of several people who look at each moment as an opportunity to move forward.  Through their daily efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children.  The members engage in retail businesses that involve selling shoes, slippers, food, cosmetics, snacks, breakfasts, clothing, and soft-boiled eggs.  

In general, the members are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and promise to complete their payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, vegetables, sacks of rice, noodles, oil, meat, and other items.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana is 41 years of age; she is living with her husband happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband owns a small general store to support his family. He is a very energetic and honest person. He is very famous in their street due to his honesty. Most of the people trust him and because of his good behavior most of the people borrow money several times and purchase goods on credit. He does not refuse any customers. Most of his customers pay back their debts on time but some of these customers pay after a long time. Now the credit sales have gone out of his limit, so he cannot buy new inventory for his general store. 
Therefore, Ramzana requested a loan for her husband from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy new inventory and keep his business running smoothly.
Ramzana says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her husband's general store

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella quiere poder terminar su carrera de abogada y poder ejercer su profesión para ayudar a las demás personas.
Quiere poder, al terminar, estudiar la carrera de psicología y también poder formar su familia y casarse. Ella es una persona que se destaca por su esfuerzo y sus ganas de querer salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y así tener la oportunidad de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Sara is from the city of Villarrica.  She wants to finish her law degree so that she can practice her profession and help other people.  

Upon finishing her degree, Sara wants to study for another degree in Psychology, as well as get married and start a family.  She is known as a person who is willing to put forth the effort and possesses the drive to succeed.  

Sara is requesting this loan so that she can invest in the payment of her fees.  This will provide her the opportunity to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Klara

texts.ru: Кларе 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 сына. У Клары - высшее образование, работает преподавателем в местной школе, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Клара занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 3,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Клары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Клара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Клара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и накопить деньги на обучение своего сына.
texts.en: Klara is 39 years old, married and raising a son together with her husband. Klara has a higher education and works as a teacher at a local school. To provide an additional source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 20 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Klara's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows and 10 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 14,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Klara requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy a cow for increasing livestock headcount. Klara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and to save money for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Rahmat

texts.ru: Рахмат трудолюбивый дехканин. Он сам работает на своей земле и кормит свою семью своим нажитом трудом. Рахмату 63 года, живет он в районе А.Джоми. У него  жена и семеро детей. Несмотря на свой возраст, он трудится все время, чтобы прокормить семью. Рахмат на своем приусадебном орошаемом участке земли, который составляет 0,42 га выращивает семечек и овощей. С месяца октября по апрель Рахмат продает семечек, а в августе и сентябре продает лук. Сейчас он готовится к осеннему посеву. Рахмат собирается посеять лук, картофель и морковь. С такой целью он просит кредит для приобретения семян лука, картофеля, моркови, а также минеральных удобрений и топливо. На выручку Рахмат хочет купить недорогую машину, чтобы возить свой товар в ближайший город. Сейчас Рахмат вывозит урожай с помощью осла.
texts.en: Rahmat is a hardworking dekhan farmer.  He works on his land himself and feeds his family with his own hard work.  Rahmat is 63 years old and lives in the A. Jomi district.  He has a wife and seven children.  Despite his age, he works all the time in order to provide for his family.  Rahmat grows sunflower seeds and vegetables on his irrigated, 0.42 hectare plot of land by his house.  Rahmat sells the seeds from October through April and sells onions in August and September.  Now he is getting ready for the autumn sowing.  Rahmat plans to sow onions, potatoes and carrots.  With this goal in mind, he is requesting this loan to buy onion, potato and carrot seeds and also mineral fertilizers and fuel.  Rahmat wants to use the profit to buy an inexpensive car in order to transport his products to a nearby city.  Currently, Rahmat transports his harvest on a donkey.

loans.use: to buy onion, potato and carrot seeds and also mineral fertilizers and fuel for the autumn sowing

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назире 43 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает сына, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Назиры - высшее образование, работает в местной школе в качестве преподавателя. Назира в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 35,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 8 лошадей, а также 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки коров. Доходы от кредита Назира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Nazira is 43 years old, a widow, raising a son after the death of her husband and running her own business. Nazira has a higher education and works as a teacher at a local school. To provide an additional source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 17 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 35,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nazira's hard work, today her business contains 3 dairy cows, 2 calves, 8 horses and also 15 heads of small livestock. The monthly income amounts to 18,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Nazira requested a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to increase livestock headcount by buying cows. Nazira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is from Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old, married and has six children. To make a living, her husband works as a private driver while she manages a retail business where she sells a variety of home products and food products. She has been in her business for over 15 years and earns PHP 12,000 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC and she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her business expansion. Now, Evangeline is requesting a new loan of PHP 15,000 which will be used to purchase additional goods like livestock feed to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods such as livestock feed to sell

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en:
Tamella is a 57-year-old widow and mother of 4 kids. For the past 10 years, she has worked as a market vendor selling goods such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. Tamella has a deep knowledge of the market and client demand. She also breeds cattle. Tamella's food products are very popular and in high demand and she earns 200 AZN monthly. Her sons help with purchasing products and bringing them to the shop. This business is the sole income for her family. Tamella is a very successful entrepreneur and her shop is in a good location in the central bazaar of her home city.

Now she is requesting a loan of 1,900 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods she offers to meet customer demand.

loans.use: to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods she offers to meet customer demand.

loans.name: Uwezesho Group

texts.en:
Daniel, who is in his early 20s, is single.  He has been running a retail shop and owns a Bajaji (tricycle) for one year now.  He works from 6.00 am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Daniel's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to restock the missing items in his shop. He dreams of having an electronic money transfer business. 

Daniel will share this loan with his loan group "Uwezesho" which has ten members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in his shop

loans.name: Kosol's Group

texts.en:
Kosol is a 61-year-old mother of four children living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. Out of her four children, she still has one dependent child. To make a living, she and her husband have been growing various kinds of vegetables for ten years. The current business earns her about 21,000 KHR per day.
This is the second microloan for Kosol with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Kosol will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en: Aysha was born in 1967. She is married and has 5 children.  Her husband is a retired man who works as a driver.
