His current work is a weak source of income which is not enough to cover his children's needs. Aysha has been working in selling detergents for one year. She started her project selling small quantities, and she found it profitable and a good support for her family. Then she decided to expand the business by building a room to open her own detergent store. She needs a good income which she can get from selling larger quantities of detergents, but she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To build a room to open her own detergent store

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Don Juan de 39 años de edad, esta casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos del hogar y a la venta de fruta preparada, tienen en común 3 hijos de 13, 9 y 5 años de edad, que viven con ellos y estuan educación básica.


Él es ordenanza desde hace 5 años, por motivos de no tener oportunidades de trabajo distintas, anteriormente trabajaba la agricultura; pero no le generaba sufiecientes ingresos para mantener a la familia. para llegar a su trabajo, debe recorrer 4 kilómetros, paga transporte diariamente, su hora de trabajo son 8 horas al día.

Con el préstamo comprara material para construir, como: cemento, hierro, ladrillo, pues una parte de la pared de su casa se esta deteriorando y desea repararla, debido a que el invierno esta minando la casa y se empieza a mojar dentro de ella. El préstamo mejorara su vida, porqué sus hijos estaran seguros y él podrá salir a trabajar más tranquilo aunque sea invierno. La necesidad a satisfacer, será la de no permitir que su casa se deteriore más y se mojen la cosas que posee.

Su sueño es, ver a sus hijos crecer y estudiar, luego que tengan un trabajo estable y una vida digna. Para su negocio le gustaría instalar una tienda en su casa. El préstamo le ayudara a reparar su vivienda y estará satisfecho y agradecido.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 years old, is married, and his wife works in the home and sells prepared fruit.  They have three children ages 13, 9 and 5 who live with them and are in primary school.

He joined the military five years ago because he did not have other work opportunities.  Previously he had worked in agriculture, but that did not generate enough income to support his family.  In order to get to work, he travels four kilometers, pays daily transportation costs, and his work day is 8 hours.

With the loan he will buy material to build part of a wall for his house since the current one is deteriorating and he wants to repair it. In the winter this deterioration worsens and it is beginning to allow leaks into the home.  He will buy cement, iron, and brick.  The loan will improve his life, since his children will be more secure and he will be able to go to work more relaxed even in the winter.  The need that is being met is to not permit his house to deteriorate more and for the things that he owns to become wet. 

His dream is to see his children grow and study, and for them to find stable and dignified work.  For his business he would like to install a store in his home.  The loan will help him repair his house and he is very satisfied and thankful.

loans.use: To buy cement, iron, and brick in order to repair deterioration on his home that is allowing water to get in.

loans.name: Aitunuk

texts.ru: Айтунук 41 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Айтунук - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айтунук занимается животноводством, стартовав 19 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айтунук, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 10 овец, а также имеет 0,10 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает кукурузу и картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айтунук обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Айтунук планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Aitunuk is 41 years old, she is married and is raising five children together with her husband. Aitunuk has secondary education and does animal husbandry as a source of main income for her family, a business which she started nineteen years ago with the purchase of cattle for 10,000 som (KGS). Because of her hard work Aitunuk now has three milk cows, ten sheep and also 0.10 hectares of land where she annually grows corn and potatoes. Her monthly income is 14,000 som. With the goal to further grow her business Aitunuk has come to the Microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS to buy sheep for feeding and further resale on the market at a higher price. Aitunuk plans to invest the income from the loan into further increase of the headcount of livestock.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Gilma Inés

texts.es: Gilma, a sus 54 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos. Desde que era muy niña su madre, quien trabajaba como empleada doméstica en diferentes casas, le enseñó a trabajar y así fue como desarrolló el gusto por todo lo relacionado con la cocina. Cuando creció, se casó y tuvo sus 2 primeros hijos, pero su esposo la abandonó dejándola a cargo de ellos, luego tuvo otra pareja sentimental con el que tuvo su hijo menor, junto a él comenzó con su propio negocio, una tienda y cafetería que tuvo por más de 12 años, pero luego su compañero sentimental falleció, sin embargo, ella supo sobrellevar su dolor y siguió adelante, trabajando para velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, gracias a ello logró adquirir su casa propia. Con el paso del tiempo cambió su tienda por un negocio de comidas rápidas y en vista de los buenos resultados que obtuvo, decidió montar su propio restaurante hace 2 años, el cual ubicó en su propia casa y poco a poco fue logrando ser reconocida por su sazón y buen servicio. La cliente es una mujer perseverante, pujante, trabajadora y dedicada a su familia y a su labor, esto la lleva a solicitar el crédito con el que desea realizar  adecuaciones locativas (adecuar un baño para los clientes) y comprar silletería y mesas nuevas, todo esto con el fin de prestar un mejor servicio y cumplir con las exigencias que le hace el control de sanidad, esto le permitirá darle una imagen más agradable a su negocio y podrá atraer más clientes que aumentarán sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Gilma sueña con hacer crecer su negocio, posicionarlo y generar oportunidades de empleo, así mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y tendrá una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Gilma, 54, is a single mother of three children.  When she was a little girl her mother, who worked as a domestic employee in different houses, taught her how to work and she liked everything having to do with cooking.  When she grew up she got married and had two children, but her husband left her.  Then she had another relationship and another child, and together they started their own business, a store and coffee shop, which they ran for 12 years.  Her partner passed away but she was able to support the pain and continue on.  She worked for her children's well-being and was able to buy her own house.

Over time she changed the store for a fast food business and, because of the success she had, decided to set up her own restaurant two years ago in her home.  Little by little she became well known for her good food and service.  The borrower is a persevering, hard-working woman who is dedicated to her family and her work.  That is why she is requesting a loan to renovate the restaurant's bathroom and to buy new tables and chairs.  This is so she can provide better service and comply with hygiene regulations and inspections.  She wants to make her business more attractive in order to attract more customers and increase sales and income.

Gilma dreams about expanding her business and offering employment opportunities.  This will improve her family's quality of life and give the household economic stability.

loans.use: To renovate the restaurant's bathroom and buy new tables and chairs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.es: Julieta, de 34 años está casada con Pablo con quien tiene 3 hijos de 15, 8 y 6 años respectivamente, vive junto a ellos en su casa propia . Julieta tiene como actividad principal la venta de productos comestibles en general, pone a la venta arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, accesorios del hogar, bebidas, embutidos entre otros. Su bodega esta instalada en su casa ubicada en una zona estratégica de su localidad. Lleva ya 4 años con este negocio, trabaja generalmente sola y en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y se siente feliz de poder compartir un negocio que los beneficia a todos. Le gusta su trabajo pues le permite disponer de su tiempo para realizar otras actividades del hogar, este negocio le genera buenas ganancias ya que siempre tiene clientes interesados en su productos y vende al por mayor a los minoristas que también tiene como clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos comestibles como huevos, jugos envasados, arroz, azúcar y algunas verduras.
texts.en:
Julieta, 34, is married to Pablo and they have three children, ages 15, 8 and 6.  They live in their own home.  Julieta has a grocery store where she sells goods such as rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, home products, beverages, sausages, etc.  Her store is in her home which is in a strategic location in the town.  She has been in business for four years and usually works alone.  Sometimes her children help and she likes sharing the activity that benefits all of them.

She enjoys her work because it allows her the time to do other household activities.  The business generates a good profit because there are always customers interested in her products.  She has both wholesale and retails clients.

On this occasion, Julieta is requesting a loan for 1,500 PEN and she is grateful to everyone making it possible for her to strive toward her goal.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time.  The loan will be used to buy food products such as eggs, fruit juice, rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy goods such as eggs, fruit juices, rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Iris Adalinda

texts.es:
Doña Iris curso hasta sexto grado de primaria y no siguió ya que sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos para que ella siguiera estudiando tiempo después se casó y vinieron los hijos. Tanto ella como su esposo trabajan juntos en el rubro del café mientras llega el momento de corte ella aporta a la economía de su familia mediante un pequeño negocio como lo es la venta de cosméticos y su esposo en ocasiones y cuando tiene la oportunidad se dedica a la venta de vehículos (carros, motos). Ellos venden el café a un comprador de la misma comunidad quien se dedica a la compra/venta mismos que lo venden a las bodegas grandes. La familia de doña Iris está compuesta por 5 hijos de los cuales la mayor ya se caso vive en hogar a parte la cual se graduó como licenciada en hostelería y turismo, el segundo vive con ellos tiene 20 años y trabaja con su padre desarrollando las diferentes actividades en el campo y cursa el último año de mecánica automotriz, el tercero tiene 15 años está en tercero de ciclo común básico al igual que el cuarto hijo el cual está en segundo de ciclo común básico y la última que tiene una edad de 5 años y está en el kínder.

Doña Iris tiene un sueño de ver graduados a sus hijos ya que ella no pudo conseguirlo apoyarles en todo lo que ella y su esposo puedan para que sus hijos sean por igual preparados y puedan con facilidad desempeñarse en cualquier ambiente de la sociedad. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara insumos agrícolas como Urea, Formula cafetalera, Abono 12-24-12, Fungicida, Plaguicida, entre otros para preparar sus cultivos de café y obtener al final de la temporada una cosecha exitosa.
texts.en:
Iris has a sixth grade education and was unable to continue because her parents did not have the economic resources for it.  She got married and had children.  Both she and her husband work in coffee production.  Until harvest time arrives, she helps out the family economy with her small cosmetics business.  Sometimes her husband sells vehicles (cars, motorcycles).  They sell their coffee produce to a buyer in their community who deals with large warehouses.  

Iris has five children and the eldest is married, has a tourism degree and lives in her own home.  The second child is 20 years old and works with his father on the farm.  He also studies auto mechanics and is in his last year.  The third child is 15 and in middle school and the fourth is behind him.  The youngest is five years old and goes to kindergarten.

Iris wants to see her children graduate because she was unable to do so.  She and her husband want to help them all to be equally trained and in a position to prosper in any social environment.  They are requesting a loan to buy farm supplies such as urea, formula for coffee plants, fertilizer 12-24-12, fungicide, insecticide and other products for their coffee crop in order to achieve a successful harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Dolores Margarita

texts.es:
Dolores es una mujer soltera de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado. Actualmente vive con sus padres y dos hermanos más. 

Ella posee una tienda en donde vende ropa, zapatos y artículos de primera necesidad. Tiene 9 años de dedicarse al comercio, esta labor se la enseño la madre desde muy joven, y tras no encontrar otra forma de ayudar a su familia decidió dedicarse a eso. Antes, de dedicarse al comercio era empleada de una tienda; pero la poca remuneración no le era suficiente para vivir,  la distancia de su trabajo está a 3 cuadras de su casa, por lo que ella lo recorre caminando, su madre le ayuda en el negocio.  

Con el préstamo  comprara, artículos como ropa, zapatos, papelería, platos, vasos entre otros.
El  préstamo mejora su negocio, por que tendrá más productos para la venta, y tendrá más ingresos  y ofrecerle a la gente más productos, la necesidad a satisfacer será la compra a tiempo de los productos y cubrir la demanda que tiene mejorara sus ingresos y mejorara la dieta alimenticia de su familia. 

Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio e instalar 3 tiendas  en el municipio donde vive,  para su familia es que cada uno logre sus expectativas y sus sueños de tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Dolores, 37, is single and has a ninth grade education.  She lives with her parents and two siblings.

She runs a store where she sells clothing, shoes and essential items.  For nine years she has been in business and learned the trade from her mother when she was young, since she could not find any other way to help the family.  She used to work as a store clerk but was not earning enough to live on.  Her store is three blocks from home so she walks to work.  Her mother helps with the business.

The loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes, paper goods, plates, cups, etc.  The loan will improve business because she will have more products to sell, and in time to cover demand.  This will improve her income and benefit the family's nutrition.

Her goal is to expand her business and open three stores where she lives.  She wants her family to meet their goals and realize their dreams of a decent lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, paper goods, plates, cups, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene resides in Aloran Misamis Occidental with her family. She has three children and her husband is a seaman. She operates their own rice farm to make a living. She borrowed 30,000 PHP from Gata Daku MPC to buy fertilizer in order to improve her farm and be able to generate an abundant harvest in return. Her children are still studying so she tries her very best in order to support them financially. She wants them all to be successful in the near future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores de 56 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir solo fue unos pocos días a  primer grado; pero sus padres no pusieron esmero en ella y fue así que le cortaron la oportunidad, en la casa quien lleva sus ingresos es el esposo quien trabaja en la agricultura, tenía tres hijas mayores de edad, pero todas están acompañadas. ella solo vive con su compañero de vida y un nieto.

Ella se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ya que el apoyo en los ingresos es su compañero de vida. Los oficios que desempeña ella, comienzan a la seis de la mañana y terminan a las ocho de la noche, cuidando al nieto y cuidando la casa.  

Con el préstamo solicitado a Fundación CAMPO  lo invertirá en la compra de cemento y pago de la mano de obra no calificada en la construcción de una habitación para tener más privacidad.

Su gran sueño es tener su dormitorio  construirlo, cuando  sea aprobado el crédito y darle una buena educación a su nieto que no se quede como ella sin saber leer ni escribir.
texts.en:
Dolores, 56, does not know how to read or write because she only attended first grade for a few days.  This was because her parents did not give her the opportunity.  Her husband is the one who works in agriculture to cover household expenses.  Her three daughters are adults and live independently with their partners.  She lives with her common-law husband and a grandson.

Dolores is a homemaker and depends on her husband for income.  She starts her chores at 6:00 a.m. and works until 8:00 p.m., caring for her grandson and the home.

She plans to use the loan requested through Fundación CAMPO to buy cement and hire workers to build on a room for more privacy.

Her greatest dream is to have her own bedroom and give her grandson a good education so he can learn to read and write.

loans.use: To buy cement and hire workers to build a room.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man who lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

He has operated a retail shop business over the years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan he is requesting he wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda, age 43, is married and they are blessed with four children. She has managed a hog raising business for almost four years. With this business she's earning a net income of PHP 4,000 for each hog that she sells. Belinda also sells food for additional income. Due to insufficient funds she would like to borrow PHP 23,000 to purchase hog feed and hogs to raise. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will become more progressive.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed and hogs to raise

loans.name: Sambat's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Sangke district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Sambat is a 33-year-old mother of one son. Rice farming and pig raising are the main sources of her family’s income. She and her husband have been doing this for seven years and her husband supplements the income by catching fish to sell.
This is the second microloan for Sambat's group with Kiva’s partner and she completely paid back the first loan. Sambat has successfully used the loan to better support her family with enough food. Sambat, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to have another source of income so as to increase her income to make a better living for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 52-year-old married father of 3 kids. Saleh grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants, and other vegetables and fruits. He says even though this business is very hard, he and his wife have been handling the business for 10 years without any difficulty. 

He grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as getting more land for cultivation. He is looking forward to increased sales in the coming autumn because people purchase lots of fruit then. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN for the purpose of buing new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming autumn, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history. This is his sixth loan.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Sopheap is aged 38 years and married with four children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. The main source of family income is from rice farming. She is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Sopheap has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sopheap is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to make a better living for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Alibek

texts.en: Alibek is an agronomist from the village Hayanist of Ararat region. He lives with his wife and son. Alibek is working as an electrician. Unfortunately his salary is so low that he can hardly make ends meet and take care of his family. To help cover their basic daily needs, the family breeds cattle. They have three cows. The barn in which the cows live is in very poor condition, and it is almost impossible to continue breeding the cows in such circumstances. A loan of USD 2500 will help the family greatly to renovate the barn and to buy some more cows to maintain their business. Alibek and his family hope for the lenders' support in collecting the required amount of money and sustaining the cattle breeding.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his barn and to buy cows to maintain his business

loans.name: Judina

texts.en: Judina is applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is married and has five children. She is running a business in the front of her house by selling noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes and rice.  She is making a good income from selling these goods and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. She is living in a town nearby the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy noodles, coffee, sugar, salt, milk, cigarettes and rice

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen resides in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental with her family. She has two children and her husband is a seaman while she runs a general store to earn a living. She borrowed 15,000 PHP to buy canned and bottled goods and rice to sell. She wants to expand her business to have more goods to offer. She plans to use the generated revenue as working capital to add to her current inventory. She hopes to see her children finish their studies and have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to buy canned and bottled goods and rice to sell

loans.name: Ariam Group

texts.en: This group is called Ariam and consists of four ladies who live in Hodeida, Yemen. Khadiga is 35 years old and married with three children. She is a hardworking person who has gone through many adversities in her life. For this reason, she has always had a great strength that has allowed her to get ahead. She is a seamstress. Her business provides her with a source of household income and support. In the beginning,  she learned this career from a sewing institute. Because her work is recognized as being good quality, she has acquired good customers recently. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase sewing items and fabrics for her business. Her dream is to be able to improve her household financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase sewing items and fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 47 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has only a single source of income, which is a sanitation shop that is owned by her husband. 

Her husband has been running this business for many years and fulfilling all the expenses of his family by himself. He sells PVC pipes for sanitation and water pipes for underground water connections, showers, bath tubs and plumbing accessories. 

He has retained a list of good customers in a short time and his business is doing well. He wants to offer white cement as well as plumbing accessories but he does not have sufficient capital for purchasing the cement nor does he have a warehouse. 

Therefore, Khalida has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy white cement and arrange a warehouse as well. 

Khalida thanks Kiva lenders and Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy white cement to be sold in her husband's sanitation shop.

loans.name: Kha's Group

texts.en:
Age 42, Kha is a married mother of three children who lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of the Battambang province in Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of income for the family. She has been in this business for 28 years.

Kha has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She has completely repaid the past loan, which enabled her to better support her family. Now leading her group of three to apply for a loan, Kha will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. 

With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Lideni Mabel

texts.es:
Lideni se graduó como bachiller en ciencias y letras por lo que ella agradece el apoyo económico y moral de parte de sus padres por haber dado la oportunidad y confianza de hacerlo; pero no pudo entrar a la universidad porque al salir del colegio decidió casarse y tener hijos. Ella trabaja junto a su esposo en la agricultura sobre todo en la siembra y cosecha de café como también el cultivo de granos básicos los cuales los destinan al consumo y venta. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que desde hace varios años su esposo le enseño a trabajar la tierra siendo el agricultor desde muy joven ya que su familia es agricultora por tradición. La tierra que cultivan es propia la cual adquirió por herencia de sus padres y quedan aproximadamente a 30 minutos de distancia de su casa de habitación. Sus clientes para el café son las diferentes bodegas de su localidad las cuales se dedican a la compra-venta de café. 

Lideni desea que su hijo y los futuros hijos cumplan sus sueños de prepararse académicamente ya que ella no pudo seguir estudiando como también sueña con dejarles la tierra para que se defiendan económicamente y tengan un mejor nivel de vida. Por esa y muchas razones más ella en compañía de su esposo trabajan duramente a diario y hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cal comprara urea, Formula cafetalera, formula 12-24-12, fertilizantes, fungicidas, plaguicidas, foliares entre otros que aran de su cosecha una buena producción.
texts.en:
Lideni graduated from high school with an emphasis in science and humanities, and she is grateful for the economic and moral support from her parents and the opportunity and confidence to do it. But she didn't go to college because when she finished high school she decided to get married and have children. She works with her spouse in agriculture, most notably in planting and harvesting coffee, but they also cultivate basic grains which they consume and also sell. She has a lot of experience because her husband has been teaching her how to work the earth for several years, as he has been a farmer from a young age and he comes from an agricultural family. They inherited the land that they cultivate from his family, which is about 30 minutes away from their house. Their coffee customers are the various local storehouses whose business is the purchase-sale of coffee.

Lideni hopes that her child and her future children reach their dreams of getting a good education since she couldn't continue studying, and she also dreams of giving them land so that they can provide for themselves economically and improve their standard of living. For this and many other reasons, she and her husband work hard every day. She is applying for a loan with which she will use to buy urea, coffee formula, 12-24-12 formula, fertilizers, fungicides, pesticides, and plants, among others, that will help guarantee a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for coffee cultivation.

loans.name: Emelda

texts.es: Emelda, de 40 años, es madre de 6 hijos a quienes cría y educa con ayuda de su esposo en su casa propia. Emelda tiene como fuente de ingresos económicos la venta de frutas y verduras regionales, desde muy temprano se dirige al puerto principal de la ciudad en busca de los mejores plátanos, limones, granadillas y granos diversos como maíz, arroz, frijoles y todo lo que considere comercial. Realiza sus ventas en el frontis de su vivienda en donde instala una mesa con todo lo que tiene para ofrecer a sus ocasionales clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo recientemente 8 meses y le esta yendo muy bien. Durante el tiempo que lleva realizando su labor aprendió muchas cosas ya que las experiencias que ha tenido en este corto tiempo le enseñaron a ser mas cuidadosa con algunos productos y a poder invertir mas en otros que tienen mayor demanda en determinados periodos. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su acceso a este financiamiento ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará frutas tales como plátanos, limones , granadillas y verduras.
texts.en:
Emelda is 40 years old and the mother of six children whom she raises and educates with the help of her husband, in the house they own. Emelda's source of income is selling local fruits and vegetables. She leaves early for the main port of the city in search of the best plantains, lemons, passion fruits, and grains such as corn, rice, beans, and other things that she will be able to sell. She sells her products in the front of her house, where she has put up a table with everything she has to offer her passing-by clients. 

She has been working like this for eight months and it is going very well. During the time she has been running this business she has learnt many things, and the experiences she has gained during this short period of time have taught her to be more careful with some products and to invest more in others that have a higher demand during certain periods. 

This time she is requesting 1,000 PEN. She is grateful to those who make this loan possible, because it will make her feel more confident in progressing with her business. She pledges to make her repayments on time. She will use the loan to buy vegetables and fruits such as plantains, lemons, and passion fruits.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits such as plantains, lemons, and passion fruits

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de básica, está acompañado. Él  comenzó a dedicarse a la agricultura desde que tenía 14 años de edad, es padre de cinco hijos, solamente un hijo vive con ellos, dos trabajan y uno estudia también, vive una nieta con ellos la cual solo dependen 3 de él..
Se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 14 años de edad, el papá fue quien lo encamino a dedicarse a la agricultura, manifiesta que el papá se lo enseño para que se pudiera defender en la vida. El lugar en donde trabaja esta a una hora de camino, viaja a pie también los demás hijos le ayudan a trabajar y él los incluya para que en el futuro también puedan salir adelante. 

Con el préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes para llevar los cultivos a su casa, ya que el lugar de donde los saca es bastante feo y quiere comprar una yunta de bueyes ya grandes y poder sacar los cultivos que le da los 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra, ya que le ha sembrado maíz, maicillo y frijoles.

El sueño de don Lorenzo es enseñarles el trabajo a sus hijos, para que ellos se defiendan en el futuro y llevar la comida a la casa y poder estar felices y en paz con Dios.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 48 years old, studied until the second grade of basic education, and has a partner. He is the father of five children, only one of which lives with them. Two work and one is studying. One of his granddaughters lives with them so only three are dependent upon him.

He began to work in agriculture when he was 14 years old. His father is the one who encouraged him to become a farmer, since it was he who taught him so that he could make a living. The place where he works is an hour away on foot, and his children help him and he includes them so that in the future, they too can get ahead.

With the loan for which he is applying, he would like to buy an ox yoke in order to be able to bring the harvest home, since the place where he harvests is fairly bad and he wants to buy a large ox yoke to be able to harvest the crops from the 14,000 square meters of land where he has planted corn, sorghum and beans.

Lorenzo's dream is to teach his children to work so that they will be able to fend for themselves in the future and bring home food and be happy and at peace with God.

loans.use: to buy an ox yoke.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Doña Flora es madre soltera de 9 hijos, con esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado que estudien y que tengan un mejor futuro, a punta de ventas de ropa, confección de fundas y elaboración de cajetas, esta señora ha logrado mantener unido a su núcleo familiar generar ingresos y ahora de sus hijos mayores recibe el fruto de su sacrificio ya que son profesionales o tiene trabajos estables. Con ella viven 4 de ellos de los cuales 2 son menores y estudian en secundaria. El deseo de la clienta con este préstamo es invertir en su negocio en la compra de sábanas y otros accesorios de cama, que le solicitan mucho en su vecindario, que donde se concentra la mayoría de su clientela. También se le reconocen sus habilidades en la costura, y cocina, por lo que es contratada en su barrio. Es representante de San Pedro de Poas, ante el Ministerio de Cultura por sus comidas y exponer las tradiciones de su comunidad.Inicia con la elaboración de cajetas, que son muy reconocidas en la zona invirtiendo 700 colones en dulce y maní hace cerca de 10 años. Después ha incursionado en otras áreas del comercio, que le han permitido diversificar su oferta de productos. Por recomendación de Deyanira, integrante del BM Emprendedoras de Chilamate contacta a FM, para logra obtener un capital para invertir en su negocio.Persona polifacética de la zona, mujer que se ha dedicado a la crianza de sus 9 hijos, buscando generar ingresos para que estudien y progresen en la vida. Reconocida en su comunidad por la calidad de sus productos y a nivel del cantón por sus comidas, Doña Flora es todo un personaje y desea recibir el crédito para que su negocio crezca y poder apoyar a sus 2 hijas menores que están en el colegio.
texts.en:
Flora is a single mother of nine children. After much effort and work on her part, she has been able to educate them so that they will have a better future. By selling clothes and making covers and sweets, she has kept her nuclear family together and generated an income so that her older children, now professionals or with stable jobs, could reap the rewards of her sacrifice. Four of her children live with her, two of whom are teenagers and studying in high school. 

This client's wish is to invest this loan in her business to buy sheets and other bedding accessories which are highly in demand in her neighbourhood, where most of her clientele are situated. Her sewing and cooking abilities are also renowned, which is why her services are sought after in her area. She has been a representative of San Pedro de Poas for the Ministry of Culture, both for her meals and for demonstrating the traditions of her community. 

Flora began making sweets which are very well known in her area about ten years ago, investing 700 colones in sweets and peanuts. After that she took on other areas of business, which allowed her to diversify her range of products. She was recommended for a loan of capital to invest in her business by Deyanira, a member of BM Entrepreneurs of Chilamate, who contacted FM. 

A multi talented person in her area and a woman who has dedicated her life to raising nine children, Flora has sought to generate an income so that they can study and progress in life. She is renowned in her community for the quality of her products and known in her canton for her meals. Flora is quite a character and wishes to receive this loan so that her business can grow and so she can support her two youngest children who are still in high school.

loans.use: to buy goods such as sheets, quilts and other items for personal use

location.town: Alajuela, San Pedro de Valverde Vega

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Como cada año, Gonzalo se prepara para la cosecha de café. El año pasado tuvo una buena producción y espera que este le vaya aún mejor. Gonzalo es socio de la “Unión Regional” donde entrega en su totalidad su producción, que es de calidad de exportación. Para esta cosecha Gonzalo solicita un crédito el cual utilizará para realizar labores de limpieza en su finca, así como para pagarle a los cortadores que contratará para que lo ayuden. Además de ser productor de café Gonzalo también produce caña de azúcar, sin embargo la situación de ese cultivo no es muy buena en México.
texts.en:
Gonzalo's getting ready for the coffee harvest as he does every year.  Last year he had a good crop, and he hopes it's even better this year.  Gonzalo's a member of Unión Regional [de Huatusco], where he delivers his entire crop, which is of export quality.

For this harvest Gonzalo's requesting a loan to perform a few cleaning tasks and pay the pruners he'll hire to help him.

In addition to coffee Gonzalo also produces sugar cane.  The situation of that crop isn't very good in Mexico, however.

loans.use: to clean his farm and to pay pruners

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia es soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en casa de familiares ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio solo hasta el nivel primario. Se dedida a la elaboracion y  comercializacion de recuerdos (colitas) para todo acontecimiento social (fiestas, cumpleaños, eventos colegiales, graduaciones de servicio militar, etc) el trabajo que elabora es todo manual (artesanal)
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de Aumento de Capital y asi poder fabricar mayor variedad de recuerdos.
El sueño de cecilia  es que sus productos (recuerdos)se distribuyan a nivel nacional y asi podra aumentar sus ingresos .
texts.en:
Cecilia is single with one child. She lives with her relatives in the city of El Alto and has only been to primary school. She works making and selling presents for all types of social events (parties, birthdays, schools events, military service graduations, etc.) and all of the items she makes are hand made.

Cecilia needs this loan to increase her working capital so that she can make a greater variety of presents. Her dream is to distribute her products on a national level so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to gain working capital for her commemorative handcraft business

loans.name: Sheena Lowe

texts.en:
Sheena Lowe resides in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, in the Phillipines, and she is studying at Stella Maris College. Her parents are earning in their jobs as caretakers. 

She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed PHP 10,000  to pay her school tuition fees for her fourth-year first semester of BS - Business Administration. 

She is hopeful of becoming successful in the near future and being able to help her family meet its needs and improve its standard of living.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for her fourth-year first semester

loans.name: Ambrosio

texts.es: El café y la caña de azúcar son los dos principales cultivos que se dan en la zona donde Ambrosio vive y él se dedica a producir los dos. Como cada año Ambrosio entrega toda su producción de café a la “Unión Regional” quien se encarga de procesarlo y exportarlo. Para esta cosecha Ambrosio ha realizado algunos trabajos de limpieza y resiembra. Debido a la extensión de su terreno le será necesario contratar trabajadores que lo ayuden en la época de corte y para poder pagarles a tiempo necesita un crédito. Al final de la cosecha pagará este crédito con las ganancias que obtenga.
texts.en:
Coffee and sugar cane are the two main crops in the area where Ambrosio lives, and he makes a living growing both.  Every year he delivers his entire coffee crop to Unión Regional [de Huatusco], which processes and exports it.

Ambrosio has performed some cleaning and replanting tasks for this harvest.  Because his land is extensive he'll need to hire workers to help him during the cutting season.  He needs a loan to be able to pay them on time.

Ambrosio will pay back the loan with his profits at the end of the harvest.

loans.use: to pay pruners

loans.name: Poch

texts.en:
Poch, age 34, stays at home and does housework. The main source of income is from her husband’s business (he is a fisherman). She has been married since 2003 and has three children - two sons and one daughter.

Poch is asking for a loan to assist in her husband’s fishing business by buying additional fishing nets.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing nets for her husband.

loans.name: Sorma

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Cheung Prey district, Sorma is 27 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a rice farmer of three hectares of farmland while her husband is a paid worker. Having been in this business for almost eight years, she currently can earn about 27,000 KHR per day.
Sorma is just with VisionFund this cycle. Now she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Pamoja Group

texts.en:
Malaki, who is in his early 30s, is married and has one small child. He has two businesses, transportation and selling water door-to-door. He works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Malaki's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants to use it to pay for buying more stocks of water, picking them up and delivering them to more customers. He dreams of buying his own car.

Malaki will share this loan with his loan group Pamoja, which has twelve members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for buying more stocks of water, picking them up and delivering them to more customers.

loans.name: Camerino

texts.es: Camerino y sus hermanos se dedican a la producción de café desde hace muchos años. Ellos aprendieron todo lo que saben gracias a su padre quien también se dedica a esta actividad. El café que Camerino produce es de calidad de exportación y cada año vende toda su cosecha a la “Unión Regional”, asociación a la cual pertenece. Para esta cosecha Camerino solicita un crédito pues debe realizar algunas labores de limpieza y chapeo en sus parcelas y además contratará a cortadores para que lo ayuden en la cosecha. Además de dedicarse a la producción de café Camerino también se dedica a producir limón.
texts.en:
Camerino and his siblings have earned a living growing coffee for many years.  They learned everything they know from their father, who also works in this field.  Camerino grows export-quality coffee, and every year he sells his entire harvest to Unión Regional [de Huatusco], an association he belongs to.

Camerino's requesting a loan for this harvest because he needs to perform some cleaning and weeding tasks on his land.  He'll also hire pruners to help him with the harvest.

Camerino also grows limes in addition to coffee.

loans.use: to clean his farm and to pay coffee pruners

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo y su padre se dedican a la producción de café pues es la principal actividad económica de la zona en la que viven. Ellos son socios de la “Unión Regional” desde hace mucho tiempo y es allí a donde venden toda su producción de café, la cual es de calidad de exportación. Para este año Pablo solicita un crédito para pagar planta de café que adquirió hace un mes y con la cual resembró parte de su terreno para así poder aumentar su producción con el paso del tiempo. Además de ser productor de café Pablo se dedica a la producción de maíz y limón, los cuales le sirven para tener un mejor ingreso para él y su familia.
texts.en: Pablo and his father grow coffee. It is the main economic activity in the area where they live. They are members of the “Unión Regional” for a long time and that is where they sell all of their coffee crop, which is export quality. For this year, Pablo is asking for a loan to pay for coffee plants he acquired a month ago to re-plant a part of his land to increase production over time. In addition to being a coffee grower, Pablo grows corn and lemons, which bring in more income for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay for coffee plants.

loans.name: Haleluya Group

texts.en:
Lucy, who is in her early 50s, is married and a mother of six children. Four of Lucy's children are grown and married, while two are in school. Lucy, together with her husband, has been managing them leaving by running two businesses: charcoal, which is under Lucy, and stationery, which is managed by her husband. They have been in these activities for three years now. Lucy's charcoal activities run from 6am to 8pm daily, and she is able to earn a small profit per month. 
From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 9th loan request which will be used to buy stationery items and more sacks of charcoal. She used her previous loans to stock more charcoal and assist her husband in restocking a few stolen stationery items, like TVs. Lucy has paid back all her previous loans successfully. She used her business profit to cover home expenses and school fees. Lucy has dreams to give her children better education and to build a nice family house.
She will share this loan with her loan group" HALELUYA" which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stationery items and more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 31 years old and married, with two children. He lives with his mother and his family. 

Elnur has a shop, and he has been in business for six years. He sells toys, perfumes, and other small goods. His mother also provides income to the family. She works as a cleaner at the hospital.

This is his third loan term, and he plans to use the amount to buy items like women's casual jewelry and trinkets to sell. He anticipates making more income, which he will use to expand the area of his shop.  Elnur aspires to save enough money to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase women's casual jewelry and trinkets to sell.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas vende leche y es maestro albañil. Hace pocos meses atrás quedo viudo, vive en casa propia, tiene cinco hijos, actualmente todos viven en la comunidad Kjasina del municipio de Achacachi, a dos   horas y  media de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  pocas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche, para su consumo.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar una vaca lechera y asi incrementar su producción, para incrementar sus ingresos para su familia

El sueño de Tomas  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, aumentando la producción y convertirse de a poco en un productor de leche en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Tomas sells milk and is a master bricklayer. He was widowed just a few months ago. He lives in his own home and has five children, all of whom are cuurently living in the community of Kjasina in the Achacachi municipality, two and a half hours from the city of La Paz. Tomas only has a few head of cattle that provide him with milk to drink.

The loan that Tomas needs will be used to buy a dairy cow so that he can increase his production and income for his family. 

Tomas's dream is to increase his head of cattle which will boost production and, bit by bit, turn himself into a milk producer in his community.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rocio

texts.en:
One of Rocio's biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help afford her school and living expenses, Rocio currently works 30 hours a week as a manager. Currently Rocio earns $6 a day. With two older siblings, Rocio is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

Becoming a professional has always been Rocio's dream. Rocio was accepted into Escuela Militar de Ingeniería and now with the chance to achieve her dream is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2013, but the graduation fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in El Alto. Without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

With a $2,000 loan, Rocio plans on using the funds to pay her graduation fee.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Doña Lucila tiene 37 años de edad y curso hasta el sexto grado, ella es agricultura desde hace muchos años y en compañía de su esposo trabajan la tierra. Su esposo también se dedica a la albañilería para obtener más ingresos para su hogar cuando tiene la oportunidad de hacerlo. Con el procrearon 5 hijos los cuales todos viven bajo su mismo techo su hijo mayor tiene 18 años y ya se graduó de la  secundaria pero no siguió estudiando porque en el hogar no hay los suficientes ingresos para que siga, la segunda hija tiene 17 años y está en primero de carrera, la tercera hija tiene 13 años y solo curso el sexto grado, la cuarta hija tiene 10 años y está en cuarto grado de primaria y la última tiene 7 años y está en segundo grado. Ella se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra por más de 15 años siendo su especialidad el cultivo de café y también elaboración de viveros también en temporadas para consumo cultivan maíz y frijol que en ocasiones también es destinado para su venta. La tierra la fueron adquiriendo poco a poco y empezaron con una pequeña parcela de tierra que fue herencia que le dejaron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra hoy en día su propiedad es más amplia aproximadamente una manzana y media de tierra cultivada gracias al esfuerzo que día a día ellos desempeñan. Su producto lo venden en intermediarios y sus cultivos están ubicados alrededor de su casa esto le facilita obtener mejores resultados en su producción en los que se involucran todos los miembros de su familia y evitan el costo de contratar más personal.

El sueño de doña Lucila es que sus hijos logren estudiar y mejorar su calidad de vida como también dejarles un patrimonio fuerte mente establecido. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 3 QQ de urea, 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 3 QQ 18-26-0 con lo que asistirá sus cultivos preparándolos para la cosecha que se aproxima y de esa manera tener un excelente resultado.
texts.en:
Lucila is 37 years old and went to school up to the sixth grade. She has been a farmer for many years and works the land with her husband. Her husband  also works as a bricklayer to being in more income for the home when he has the chance. With him, she has 5 children who all live under the same roof. Her oldest son is 18 and he graduated from secondary school but didn't continue with his studies because there isn't enough income in the home. The next oldest, a daughter, is 17 and she is in her last year of high school. The next oldest, a daughter, is 13 and only went to school up to the sixth grade. The fourth oldest, a daughter, is 10 and in the fourth grade of primary school, and the youngest, a daughter, is 7 and in second grade. She has worked the land for more than 15 years and her specialty is growing coffee as well as making plant nurseries in season. They grow corn and beans for their own consumption as well as to sell sometimes. They acquired the land little y little and started with a small parcel that was inherited from her parents. They were the ones who taught her to work the land. Today her property is approximately 1.05 hectares of cultivated land thanks to their hard work day to day. They sell their product to middlemen and their crops are grown around their house. This facilities getting a better result with the yield, involving all of the family members and avoiding the cost of hiring more workers.

Lucila's dream is for her children to be able to go to school and improve their quality of life, as well as to leave them a strongly established inheritance. That is why at this time she has asked for a loan to buy 3 quintals of urea, 3 quintals of 12--24-12 formula, and 3 quintals of 18-26-0 formula to help prepare her crops for harvest, which is growing near, and to have an excellent result.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Tuychi

texts.ru: Туйчи живет в районе Восеъ, ему 50 лет. Он бухгалтер в сельской школе, а также опытный земледелец. Туйчи женат. У него сын в возрасте 27 лет и две дочери в возрасте 17 и 14 лет. Его жена домохозяйка, сын работает в банке кассиром, а дочери учатся в школе. Туйчи занимается растениеводством на протяжении более 18 лет. Свободное от роботы время, он проводит на земле. Туйчи выращивает такую сельскохозяйственную культуру, как хлопок, пшеница, лук. Средства, полученные от кредита пойдут на удобрения земли и озимые посевы. Кредит поможет Туйчи обработать землю, посеять семена лука и пшеницы, собрать хороший урожай и получить хорошую прибыль. В будущем он собирается расширить свою земледельческую деятельность.
texts.en:
Tuychi lives in the Vose region. He is 50 years old. He is an accountant at the village school and also has experience as an agriculturist. He has a son of the age of 27 years and two daughters aged 17 and 14. His wife is a housewife, his son works as a cashier at a bank and the daughters go to school. 

Tuychi has worked with crop production for a period of more than 18 years. He spends his spare time on the field. Tuychi plans crops such as cotton, wheat and onions. The income he receives from the loan goes on fertilizer land and on winter crops. The loan helps Tuychi process the land, sow onion and wheat seeds, harvest good crops and receive a good income. In the future he will expand his agriculture business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and onion seeds, as well as mineral and organic fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулноре 42 года. Она вдова и воспитывает своих 5 детей сама. Она живет в сельской местности. Гулнора после смерти мужа пережила много тягостей жизни, так как ей было очень трудно справляться с семейными расходами. Она начала свой бизнес купле продажей скота. Гулнора постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Она продает скот на местном рынке. Гулнора справляется с бизнесом одна, так как ее старший сын находится в Российской Федерации. Гулнора планирует отремонтировать свой маленький и старый домик. Ее дом имеет плохое состояние и нуждается в капитальном ремонте. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесину и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Gulnora is 42 years old. She is a widow and she is raising five children by herself. She lives in a village. After the death of her husband, Gulnora experienced many of life's burdens, as it was difficult for her to cope with the family's expenses. She started her business of animal sales. Step by step Gulnora developed her business. She sells livestock at the local market. 

Gulnora manages the business by herself, as her oldest son is in the Russian Federation. Gulnora plans to repair her small and old house. Her house is in a bad condition and is in need of major repairs. She requests a loan in the amount of 2,500 somoni for the purchase of building materials, such as cement, wood and similar. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement and wood, for repairing her house

loans.name: Las Productoras  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las Productoras está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven en la parroquia Baños  en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una geografía accidentada la misma que le regala hermosos paisajes, las aguas termales que emana del volcán son propicias para disfrutar de varias piscinas, su gastronomía y la cultura de su gente hacen de este lugar un sitio muy turístico. Todas las socias aun guardan la cultura y tradiciones inculcadas por sus padres, su meta es salir en adelante con sus hijos y brindarles un mejor futuro, esto  esperan lograrlo con cada préstamo que reciben.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Digna Lucia, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza a lado de sus amigas y compañera del grupo de crédito Las Productoras,   le gusta esta forma de créditos porque les dan la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios para sacarles adelante a sus familias.

La Señora Digna Lucia tiene 24 años de edad, vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años que estudian en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico industrial y labora en su propio taller, la casa en la que viven es  propia.

Doña Digna Lucia desde hace 8 años trabaja en el taller su esposo de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo, también eventualmente trabaja como ayudante de cocina. 

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de hierro, soldaduras y lubricantes para el taller de su esposo. 

Su meta es tener una boutique.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Productoras consists of eight women who live in the Baños parish in Cuenca, a place characterized by its hilly geography offering beautiful landscapes. Its thermal waters, emanating from the volcano, makes it possible to enjoy various baths. The gastronomy and culture of its people attract many tourists. The members of this group all carry the culture and traditions passed on by their parents. Their goal is to get ahead with their children and offer them a better future. They hope to achieve this with the help of every loan they receive.

One of the members of this group is Digna Lucia, she is in her second loan cycle together with her friends and partners of the Las Productoras group. She likes this type of loan because it gives them the opportunity to grow in their businesses so that they can move their families forward. Digna Lucia is 24 years old and is in a civil union from which she has two children aged 8 and 6, who go to a small school in the locality. Her husband is an industrial mechanic and works in his own workshop. They live in their own house.

Digna Lucia has been working in the workshop together with her husband for eight years, from Monday to Saturday and without a fixed schedule. She also works occasionally as a kitchen helper. She will use the loan to buy iron, welding supplies, and lubricants for her husband's workshop. Her goal is to run a boutique.

loans.use: to buy iron, welding supplies, and lubricants

loans.name: Patricia Martha

texts.en:
One of Patricia's biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help afford her school and living expenses, Patricia currently works 30 hours a week as a kiln operator. Currently Patricia earns $22 a day. With a degree in business she expects to earn $27 a day. 

Patricia's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family of five, finances have always been tight. With two older siblings attending college already, Patricia is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. 

Patricia dreams of becoming a metallurgist. Patricia is currently attending Escuela Industrial Superior Pedro Domingo Murillo, working towards her degree in business. Often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. She plans on graduating in November, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. With a $729 loan, Patricia plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Yet's Group

texts.en:
Yet, 56 years old, lives with her husband and four children in a rural village of the Dambae district, Cambodia. 

To feed the family, Yet and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been farming rice and cassava for 36 years, earning about US$9 per day to spend on the family’s needs.

This is Yet’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  Her group has only two members; it has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles. She and her fellow member completely paid back their past loans with VisionFund.  Yet used the loans to improve her family’s livelihood. 

As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. Yet is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business.  She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to generate more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: A Domingo desde pequeño le gustó el campo, pues por generaciones su familia se ha dedicado a trabajar allí. Domingo conoce de todo, desde cría de ganado hasta la producción de diversos cultivos. Actualmente Domingo se dedica a la producción de caña de azúcar y de café, siendo este último su principal actividad económica. El café que Domingo produce es de calidad de exportación y lo vende a la “Unión Regional”. Para esta cosecha Domingo necesita un crédito para comprar fertilizantes y para pagar a los cortadores que contratará para que lo ayuden en el trabajo en el campo.
texts.en: Since Domingo was little, he has liked the countryside. Generations of his family have worked there. Domingo knows about everything, from raising cattle to growing different crops. Right now Domingo grows sugar cane and that is his main economic activity. The coffee that Domingo produces is of export quality and he sells it to the “Unión Regional”. For this crop, Domingo needs a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for the cutter whom he will hire to help with the field work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for cutters.

loans.name: Valeria Lucia

texts.en:
Valeria has always dreamed of becoming a nutritionist. Valeria was accepted into the Universidad Privada Domingo Savio Tarija and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She expects to graduate in November, 2013, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She says that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Valeria says that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help afford her school and living expenses, Valeria currently works 30 hours a week as a store clerk.

With a $102 loan, Valeria plans on spending the money towards purchasing her textbooks. Since they are an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Valeria hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. With a career in nutrition, she expects to earn $17 a day, a substantial increase from before. As the youngest in the family, with one older sibling attending college already, Valeria is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Silvestre

texts.en:
Working in systems engineering is Jose's dream. Jose is currently attending the Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia, working towards his degree in business. He expects to graduate in December, 2013, but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He says that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Jose says that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a $714 loan, Jose plans on using the funds to pay his tuition while he saves his salary from his part-time job. With a career in business, he expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before. To help afford his school and living expenses, Jose currently works 30 hours a week as a information technician and earns $5 a day.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Milton Nano

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Milton's dream. To achieve his goal, Milton has enrolled in the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi. He plans on graduating in December, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Milton plans on spending the money towards purchasing his textbooks, which are often not purchased in order to save money. With them Milton hopes to be able to better understand his coursework. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Milton currently works 30 hours a week as a laborer and earns $13 a day. With a career in business, he expects to earn $17 a day. Unfortunately, Milton's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher education degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With one younger brother and one younger sister, Milton hopes to be a role model for his younger siblings by being the first in his family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for books.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
For Vilma, she has to work harder in order to enlighten her family living. Prior to managing charcoal sales, she once had a general-store business. She has realized that doing the charcoal sales creates better income to her; thus, she focused on doing the business rather than managing her store. 

She is already 49 years old and is living very simply in the village of Caliat with her family. Her husband is a carpenter laborer; with him, she works together toward meeting the immediate needs of the family. She has been managing the charcoal sales for three years, and most of the time, she earns 1,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) each week from the business. 

Her income goes toward the school allowance of her youngest child in high school. It also goes to her savings, loan amortizations and the family's food consumption. She is asking for the loan as additional business capital to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire goods, expand her catalogue of products and increase her sales

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man. He has owned a clothing store since 2011. He is newly occupied by this type of business, but he is working really hard and shows very persuasive selling skills. He loves his job and always seeks the best. 

Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory with a new winter collection. This season is about to begin, and he needs to get ready to satisfy his customers' demands. In the future, Hussein is looking forward to expanding his business into other areas, and in addition, he will start to sell shoes and women's accessories with the aim of earning higher income and living in better conditions.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory with a new winter collection.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. In addition to the bakery business, Samuel has a motorbike, which he uses to transport people.  He is requesting a loan of ksh 50,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorbike. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, esta casado desde hace 36 años, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus tres hijos ya no viven con él, solo una hija de crianza y una nieta.

Él es agricultor y comerciante, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante y 5 años de haber puesto su propia tienda en su casa. El trabajo lo aprendió solo y decidió dedicarse a eso, porque lo que le genera la agricultura es poco. Desarrolla su trabajo solo y va a vender todos los días por la mañana.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar arroz, aceite, golosinas y otros artículos de primera necesidad; esto le ayudara a tener mejores ingresos  y satisfacer la demanda de compra que tiene en la comunidad y no vayan lejos a comprar.

Su objetivo, es instalar un puesto de venta en el mercado de su municipio, para ya no salir a vender fuera de su casa. Espera  que su familia tenga una vida digna y aprendan a luchar trabajando y que sean personas de bien. La ganancia del préstamo la invertirá en arreglar una parte de su casa, que por falta de dinero no ha podido terminar. Así, tendrá mas espacio para su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 53, went to school through sixth grade. He has been married for 36 years, and his wife works in the home. Their three children no longer live with them, but a foster daughter and a granddaughter do.

He is a farmer and shopkeeper with 12 years experience in traveling to sell fruits and vegetables. He also has 5 years experience of running his own shop from his home. He learned these skills on his own and decided to work in this sector because he doesn't earn much from farming. He developed his work himself and is going to sell every day in the mornings. 

He is requesting this loan to buy rice, oil, sweets, and other basic necessity items. This will help him have a better income and satisfy the purchasing demand in the community so people don't have to go far to shop.

His goal is to open a stall in his town's market so he doesn't have to go far from his home to sell anymore. Rigoberto wants his family to have a decent life and he wants them to learn to work hard and be good people. He will also invest part of the loan into repairing his home, since he wasn't able to finish this project, due to a lack of money. This will give his family more space.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sweets, and other basic necessity items

loans.name: Luz Patricia

texts.en:
Luz dreams of becoming a professional, but without a degree it may never be possible. Luz is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, working towards her degree in tourism. She expects to graduate in December, 2014, but without a loan, she is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She says that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. For Luz, it is important to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Luz plans on paying her graduation fees. These fees are often more expensive than the semester's tuition and are a frequent impediment for graduating students in Bolivia. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Luz currently works 30 hours a week independently and earns $15 a day. With a degree in business, she expects to earn $20 a day. 

Luz's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family, finances have always been tight. Luz hopes to be a role model for her younger brother by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Celmy Rosario

texts.en:
Celmy dreams of becoming a accountant. Celmy was accepted into the Instituto Tecnico Superior Fe y Alegria and expects to graduate in March, 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She says that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Celmy says that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. Celmy plans on spending her loan to purchase her textbooks, which are often not bought to save money. With them Celmy hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. 

With a career in business, she expects to earn $12 a day. Celmy's parents were never able to complete their primary education. With three older siblings, Celmy is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Celmy is married with her own child, but this has not stopped her from pursuing her dreams. With a professional degree and a career in business, she will be able to provide her family with a better life. Celmy currently works 30 hours a week as a teacher to help afford her school and living expenses.

loans.use: To pay for books.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen is aged 36 and married. She has two children. Living in a village of the Cheung Prey district, Yen is a rice farmer, who grows rice on one hectare of farmland. Having been in this business for several years, she manages to earn about 24,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children.

Yen has requested a loan with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past three loans, which has enabled her family to buy a plot of farmland. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Kimly's Group

texts.en:
Kimly, 34, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Sa Ang district. She has four children, some of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been selling clothes while her husband plants mango to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 8,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

There are three members in Kimly’s loan group and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her mango plantation and use a portion of it to spend on buying more clothes to resale. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her mango plantation.

loans.name: Ma Clementina

texts.es:
Doña Ma Clementina tiene una edad de 42 años con un grado de educación cursado hasta el quinto grado de primaria y su esposo curso hasta cuarto grado. Su primer hijo tiene 23 años de edad curso el ciclo común y no siguió estudiando ya que prefirió apoyar a su padre, el segundo hijo tiene 21 años se graduó de bachillerato en técnico en computación, el tercer hijo tiene 18 años curso ciclo común, el cuarto hijo tiene 16 años de edad esta en primer año de carrera y está estudiando bachillerato en computación e informática y el último de sus hijos tiene 16 meses de nacido. Su actividad económica es el cultivo de café y compra de vivero al final de cada cosecha el producto es distribuido en las bodegas de la ubicadas en las zonas aledañas. Sus cultivos están al lado de su casa de habitación la cual tiene entrada para vehículo pero ellos se trasladan a pie. Fueron sus padres que desde pequeña le enseñaron esta actividad y el terreno donde ella cultiva fue herencia de por parte de ellos en el cual al momento de su mantenimiento y demás actividades se involucran todos los miembros de su hogar.

Doña Ma Clementina tiene como meta dar a sus cultivos la mejor asistencia posible para poder obtener una excelente cosecha pudiendo generar mayores ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios ya que para ella es una prioridad que sus hijos se preparen. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 4 QQ de urea, 4 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 4 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 para asistir sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ma Clementina is 42 years old and attended primary school through the fifth grade.  Her husband went through the fourth grade.  Her first child is 23 years old and finished middle school.  He did not continue studying since he preferred to support his parents.  Her second child is 21 years old and graduated from technical high school with a degree in computers.  Her third child is 18 years old and finished middle school.  Her fourth child is 16 years old and is studying in computers and information technology in high school.  Her last child is 16 months old.  

She works cultivating coffee and buying from nurseries at the end of each harvest.  Her product is distributed in the warehouses located in nearby areas.  Her crops are located next to her home.  It can be reached by car, but they travel on foot.  Her parents taught her this work when she was young and the land she plants was an inheritance from them.  Today, the crop maintenance and other farming activities involve all of the members of the household.

Ma Clementina's goal is to give her crops the best help possible to obtain an excellent harvest so that she can generate more income and continue supporting her children with their studies, since it is a priority for her that they are educated.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase four quintals of formula 12-24-12 and four quintals of formula 18-46-0 to assist her crops.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rubi Ines

texts.en:
Rubi is majoring in English because she believes it will benefit her career in the long run. Rubi was accepted into the First Class Institute and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees.
