texts.en:
Durbelly, 36, is married and mother of two children.  Some time ago due to the lack of employment opportunities she decided to start her own business to earn income on her own and be able to help her husband support the family.  She opened a small store in a sector of the city where her advantage is not having any nearby competition.  To date, she’s had good results and has been able to generate income to cover basic household expenses.

She is a driven, hardworking, active and enterprising woman who states that she likes her work because she manages her own time, generates income and can watch over her home.

She’s asking for the loan now to buy stock merchandise at wholesale (cleaning supplies, packaged snacks, crackers and cookies, sweets and basic staple items) so that she can increase her inventory and offer more variety of goods to her customers meeting their needs and various tastes.  This will be reflected in higher sales and thus income earned.

Durbelly dreams with making he business grow and strengthen to become a minimarket where she can generate employment and have economic stability to guarantee better well-being for her children and to have better quality of life in the future in the medium run.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise at wholesale.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina, de 36 años, está casada desde hace 11 años con José y junto a él tiene 3 hijos, con quienes vive en su casa propia. Karina se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles y artículos de primera necesidad como cereales, arroz, pan, huevos, aceite, leche y otros. Compra sus productos al por mayor en el mercado principal de la ciudad obteniendo sus productos a precios cómodos lo cual le ayuda a obtener algunos centavos adicionales como ganancia. Tiene su bodega en un reducido espacio de su vivienda, trabaja en esta actividad desde hace 3 años y desde que empezó siempre ha trabajado sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da independencia para realizar otras actividades, lo que no le gusta es que siempre hay personas que solicitan algún producto al crédito y al momento establecido para pagarle, no lo hacen, por ese motivo prefiere vender ahora todo al contado. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, agradece a las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de contar con un capital de negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el préstamo solicitado comprará productos comestibles como arroz, azúcar, algunas verduras, huevos y leche ya que estos productos tienen mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Karina, 36, has been married to José for 11 years and they have three children together living with them in her own house.  Karina works selling groceries and basic staple items like cereals, rice, bread, eggs, oil, milk and others.  She buys her goods at wholesale in the city’s main market at good prices which helps her to earn a few cents more in profit.  

Her store is located in a cramped space at home.  She’s worked at this activity for the last three years and has worked alone since the beginning.  What she likes about her work is the freedom it gives her to do other things and what she dislikes is that there are always folks who ask for some product on credit and when the scheduled moment to pay comes they don’t do so; this is why she prefers to sell everything for cash now.

On this occasion she’s going to request 1,500 soles.  She thanks the people who provide her with the opportunity of having business capital to rely on and also commits to make her payments punctually.  She will use the requested loan to buy food items like rice, sugar, some vegetables, eggs and milk since these are the products in highest demand.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es: Marino, de 53 años, es un hombre trabajador. vive en compañía de su esposa Vicenta y sus hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres . Desde más de 30 años dedicó su tiempo y esfuerzo a la ganaderia y agricultura, comenta que desde niño comenzó a cuidar de la tierra por lo que según su propias palabras, “es lo único que sabe hacer”. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano comienza el día con el cuidado de sus animales a quienes alimenta y pasta en las grandes praderas de su pueblo, que se ubican a varias horas de distancia de su casa, por lo que llega al atardece a guardar a los animales para dormir. Durante ese día aprovecha el tiempo para cuidar de sus sembríos pues a esa actividad también se dedica Marino, “cuando los animales se encuentran maduros, comercializo los ejemplares en la feria que se realiza en la zona, los días viernes de cada semana”, comenta. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Marino, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de comida balanceada para sus animales, asimismo comprará ovejas, burros y toros con el resto de dinero.
texts.en:
Marino, 53, is a hardworking man living with his wife, Vicenta, and their children who he cares for in the house he inherited from his parents.  He’s dedicated his time and effort to agriculture and raising livestock for more than 30 years.    He comments that he started working the land when still a child and as he himself states: it’s the only thing he knows how to do.

He rises daily very early in the morning to start his day caring for his animals that he feeds and takes out to pasture in the big pastureland in town located several hours away from his house.  He returns at dusk and brings the animals in to sleep.  

He takes advantage of the day to care for his crops because this is another of Marino’s activities.  “When the animals are mature I sell them in the local livestock market that takes place every Friday,” he comments.  

This is his second Kiva loan and he’s grateful for the support provided because he’ll be able to continue investing in his business’ progress.  He also commits to be punctual with his payments.  Marino will use the 3,500 soles to buy balanced animal feed as well as to buy sheep, donkeys and bulls with the rest of the money.

loans.use: to buy sheep, burros, bulls and animal feed.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Don Carlos de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia, él se dedica a trabajar en su molino, procesando todo tipo de alimentos, como maíz, frijoles, harinas, salsas, entre otros. Tiene ya algún tiempo con el negocio y posee amplia experiencia que le ayuda a generar muy buenas ganancias, es muy conocido por las personas de la localidad y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, por los precios accesibles y por el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes, es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, se siente satisfecho y muy cómodo con su negocio, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda por el servicio y sus dos molinos ya no le dan abasto por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar un molino nuevo de trabajo. Tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, se compromete a cancelar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevará seguridad económica y emocional a su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos is 54 years old and lives in his own home with his family.  He works at a mill, processing all types of food like corn, beans, flour, and salsas, among other things.

He has already had the business for some time and has ample experience that helps him generate good earnings.  He is well known by people in his community and has many customers who prefer his quality, affordable prices, and unmatched service.  

He is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work.  He feels satisfied and very comfortable with his business.  In the last few weeks, the demand for his services has increased and his mills can no longer produce the necessary supply.  This is why he is asking INTEGRAL for a loan to purchase a new working mill.  

He has excellent payment references and he is responsible.  He promises to cancel the debt from the loan, and at the same time has faith that it will bring economic and emotional security to his family.

loans.use: to buy a new working mill

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don José de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo el posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia, es un hombre trabajador, responsables y honesto, adicional a eso también se dedica a la crianza de cerdo, tiene mucha clientela pues tiene la tienda muy surtida, las personas lo prefieren y lo mantienen delante de la competencia porque siembre tiene lo que necesita con productos de calidad, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar las necesidades de su casa, don José está solicitando un crédito para  poder mejorara su vivienda quiere construir dos cuartos para poder hacer su tienda más amplia y que su familia viva mas cómodos por esa razón solicita el crédito para comprar: cemento, ladrillos, hierro, pago de manos de obra, etc. y así poder vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
José is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and their son.  He has a store in his place of residence.  He is a working, responsible, and honest man.  

In addition to this, he also breeds pigs.  He has many clients since he has a very well-stocked shop. People prefer his shop which keeps him ahead of the competition, because he always has what they need and quality products.  With the money he earns, he can cover some of the household expense.  

José is requesting this loan to better his place of living.  He would like to construct two rooms to have a more ample space for his store and so that his family can live more comfortably.  For this reason he is requesting this loan to buy: cement, bricks, iron, to pay the workers for their handiwork, etc.  This will help him to live better with his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, iron, to pay laborers for their handiwork, etc.

loans.name: Ghzala

texts.en:
Ghzala is 34 years old and a married woman.  She has four children, three of them in school. 

She has been in the business of selling cosmetics for seven years.  She offers various items such as creams, beauty products, etc., to her customers. She has become famous for providing good quality products in her locality. 

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics products.  But having low cash in hand, she contacted the Kashf Foundation to apply for her fifth loan. She needs a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy hair care products, skin products, lipsticks, and makeup kits. 

She is hopeful of catering to more customers as time goes on.  She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products, lipsticks, and makeup kits.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Don Jorge de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura siembra masi y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Jorge está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para seguir con sus siembras como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, controles de plagas, etc. y así poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge, 44, lives in his own house with his wife and three children.  For the last 25 years he’s worked in agriculture growing corn and beans that he sells in various markets located near his place of residence using income from sales to cover some of his household expenses.

Jorge’s asking for a loan to be able to buy the necessary supplies like fertilizer, manure, seeds, pest control, etc. to continue with his crops and be able to have better economic stability with his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña teresa de 47 años  vive en casa propia  junto con su esposo y sus 3 hijo,  ella se dedica a la venta de minutas desde hace dos años lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, es muy trabajadora, responsable y con buenas referencias personales, posee un buen record crediticio ; ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar materiales para elaborar las minutas como hielo, jaleas de sabores, vasos y cucharas y seguir con su negocio que le genera mayores ingresos y así podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa, 47, lives in her own house with her husband and three children.  She has worked selling flavored shaved ice for two years from place to place in various neighborhoods near her place of residence.  She’s very hardworking, responsible with very good personal references.  She has a good credit history.

She’s requesting a loan to buy supplies like ice, flavored syrups, glasses and spoons to make the shaved ice treats and stay in business and generate higher income to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ice, flavored syrups, glasses and spoons.

loans.name: Yolanda Veronica

texts.es: Doña Yolanda de 34 años de edad  vive en casa  propia  es soltera  no tiene hijos es una mujer muy emprendedora , trabajadora  y  muy responsable  posee un negocio de  sala de belleza  situada  en su casa  tiene mucha clientela por su buen trabajo, buenos precios y la amabilidad con que los atiende, Yolanda  está solicitando el crédito  para  la compra de  mercadería como:  ganchos, cremas, tintes y peróxidos para el cabello, etc. esto para incrementar el inventario  y sobre todo  poder generar aun más ganancias y poder alcanzar una estabilidad económica como una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 34, lives in her own house.  She’s single and has no children.  She’s a very enterprising, hardworking, very responsible woman who owns a beauty salon located at home.  She has a large clientele because of her good work, good prices and kind way of tending to them.

Yolanda’s asking for the loan to buy merchandise like clips, creams, dye and peroxide for hair, etc. to increase inventory and above all to generate higher profits to reach economic stability and better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman who has three children, who attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over five years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock to sell, including green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell, including green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 50 years old. She operates a clothing shop in the Manjengo area of Narok. She has been running the business for 20 years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000.

She has borrowed a seventh loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD. With the funds, she intends to purchase more clothing for the business. The anticipated profit will be ploughed back into the business for expansion.

Her dreams are to improve her living standards and to own her residential plot.

loans.use: to buy additional clothing for resale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman, with two children, both in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major business challenges.  Joyce dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, biscuits, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice,  beans, biscuits, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar tela, hilos, botones, zippers, entre otros. 
Cuenta que el crédito anterior le permitió realizar su actividad con más rapidez y mas garantizado. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Juan has presented the need to opt for a new loan because he needs more working capital to continue his business.  This investment will help him to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.  

Note that the previous loan allowed him to perform his activity more quickly and with more guarantee.  The economic conditions and the family circumstances remain the same.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zipper, and other materials

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is running a shop where she sells charcoal in the area of New Kru Town. She has run this business for seven years now. She makes lots of profit since she is the only one who sells charcoal by the bag in her community. She is asking for a loan to buy more charcoal by the bag for her business. She explains that her profits are used for house rent, food, school fees, and to improve her savings account. One problem she faces is the rainy season. She started this business at her house just by selling soft drinks in her front yard, using money given to her by her husband, who works with the government as an office assistant. They have a seven-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. Patience is 26 years old, and she was unfortunate to finish the 10th grade. She hopes to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal by the bag

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been in the tailoring business for the past ten years. In this way, she helps her husband financially in meeting household expenses and in supporting the educational needs of their children. Along with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, Zahida is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she requested for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more reels of thread along with the packs of buttons and laces. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Zahida hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a high quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread along with packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is 39 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for many years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. 

When Khalida was not earning, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her hard work has helped her establish a good clientele, but she has difficulty fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from the Kashf foundation. 

Khalida is in her 3rd loan cycle, with a good repayment history.  Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000. She intends to use this amount to purchase a new sewing machine, along with some spools of threads in different colors. 

It will help her to complete the orders of her customers on time and that will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, along with some spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Sharifan is a 51-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been in this business for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. She also deals in the work of animal sales on seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Assia

texts.en:
Assia is a 32-year-old vigorous married woman. She has had a hand-embroidery business for the past five years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed but has a low salary, and he does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Assia's embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of four and is motivated to provide her children with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes and education. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as spools of threads, sequins and pearls in different colors to complete the orders of her customers on time. Her dream is to open her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in different colors.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia, age 28, is a married woman and mother of three. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community with the support of her husband. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR, which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is 35 years old, married and a father of three children. For the last ten years, he has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from his food kiosk in Malindi. He earns a monthly income of about KES 10,000 from the business. 

Kazungu is applying for his fourth loan of KES 40,000 to buy additional stock for his kiosk such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges, onions and more to sell to his customers. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children, as well as to continue expanding the business. His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may uplift his family's financial stability.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits and vegetables for his business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is married, with three children, all in school. She lives in her own house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Rehema has operated a fruits and vegetable stall business for the past five years. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-green grocer in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Rukhsana is 52 years old and a married woman.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. By this time, she has attained a list of regular customers. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to satisfy the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf Foundation. It will help her to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. These materials will be for her a means of increasing revenues, so she may able to generate a healthier income. She is in her third loan cycle, with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is 47 years old, a married woman, and a mother of four.  She is a hardworking mother, who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She has been doing this work for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She will use the loan to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons, to satisfy the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 26-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store, with her husband, at the corner of her house. She offers various items for daily use. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market since he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Khalida wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 36-year-old married lady, and she has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family, as her husband is employed at a low salary.  

To fully stock her store, she has requested a loan for PKR 20,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en:
Rifat is a 40-year-old widow. She has been sewing clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons. These supplies will help her to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her second loan cycle with a good loan history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Barkat

texts.en:
Barkat is a 39-year-old married woman who has had a business of milk sales for the past six years. 

She has one buffalo for milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. 

Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life.  She has five children, all in school.  She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing.  

She has improved her business to meet the day to day expenses of life. She has some past savings, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to purchase another buffalo. 

She hopes to have an increase in the production of milk, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 33 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to satisfy the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. These supplies will be for her a means of increasing revenue, so she may able to generate a healthier income. She hopes to grow her business and wants to provide a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 37 years old, a married lady, and a mother of four children. She is very talented and excels in the work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She initiated her business to support her husband financially, and to contribute to the family income. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Recently, Rubina requested a loan of Rs. 20,000. She will use the loan to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers and lace, in various colors. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Rubina hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of buttons, zippers and lace, in various colors.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip has a retail shop that he has been running for the past three years in the town of Kangundo. He is 22 years old and single. The business has been profitable, and he supports five members of his family.

Philip plans to use the loan to buy more stock of retail goods to sell. These include sugar, maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and detergents among other items. Having paid his previous loan successfully, this will be his second loan term with KADET.

He anticipates making more income which he will invest in agriculture.

Philip hopes to be successful in his business and to be able to support his family.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods to sell.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña María Concepción tiene 39 años de edad es casada y madre de 6 hijos, agricultora y ama de casa que en compañía de su esposo cultivan papa, maíz y frijol siendo sus clientes los diferentes intermediarios y personas que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria incompleto la cual no pudo terminar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ya que ellos eran de escasos recursos. Sus hijos ayudan en las diferentes actividades que se realizan en el campo como limpieza, aplicación de abono, corte, etc. que ayuda a mejorar sus cultivos pero solo 2 de ellos estudian. Ella aprendió a trabajar la tierra gracias a sus abuelos mismos que agradece el apoyo y paciencia en ese momento para que ella aprendiera a cultivar. La tierra que ella trabaja es propia gracias al esfuerzo que han puesto y dedicado por varios años las cuales están ubicadas a 5 minutos de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie juntos en familia.

Los planes y metas de doña María Concepción son los de poder al final de la cosecha poder obtener una buena producción de papa con calidad e higiénica haciéndola más atractiva para los diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona. De esa manera ella podrá generar más ingresos para el sustento de su familia como también el apoyo para sus 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando. Por lo que hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual comprara 8 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12, 10 QQ de cal, 12 QQ de gallinaza, 5 litros de curion y2 litros de curzate.
texts.en:
María Concepción, 39, is married and mother of six children.  She’s a housewife and works in agriculture with her husband growing potatoes, corn and beans.  Her customers are various middlemen and people who come to the zone looking for good products.  

She did not complete primary school because her parents did not have the economic resources for her to do so.  Her children help with the various field chores like weeding, fertilizing, pruning, etc. that help the crops grow; only two of them attend school.  She learned to work the land thanks to her grandparents who she thanks for their patience and support back then so that she could learn how to work the land.  The land she works is hers thanks to the effort and dedication she’s exerted for years; the land is located five minutes from home so they get to it together as a family on foot.

María Concepción’s plans and goals are to be able to get a good crop yield of potatoes at the end of the season that are of good quality and hygienic so that it’s more attractive to various buyers that come to the zone.  In this way, she’ll be able to generate higher income for family support as well as to support the schooling of her two children who are in school.  She’s today asking for a loan to buy 8 quintals of formula 12-24-12, 10 quintals of lime powder, 12 quintals of bird guano, 5 liters of Curion and 2 liters of Curzate [fungicide].

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her potato crop.

loans.name: Mirna Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Mirna  de 43 años de edad  vive en casa propia junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda desde hace 13 años donde comercializa, granos básicos, refrescos, sopas, pañales, etc. es una mujer con valores cristianos,  responsable y  además de ello tiene buenas referencias personales, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Mirna está solicitando un crédito para poder realizar la compra de  mercadería para la tienda y poder surtirla ya que tiene una gran demanda de sus productos con esto poder incrementar sus ingresos y  obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirna, 43, lives in her own house with her husband and two children.  She’s owned a store for 13 years where she sells basic grains, soft-drinks, soups, diapers, etc.  She’s a responsible woman of Christian values who also has good personal references.  She uses what she earns from her sales to cover some of her household expenses.

Mirna’s asking for a loan to buy merchandise for her store to stock it because her products are in high demand and she’ll be able to increase her income this way and attain better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Cruz Antonia

texts.es: Doña cruz vive humildemente con su esposo y sus hijos en casa propia, su esposo trabaja en construcciones cerca de su lugar de residencia, desde hace varios años ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, comercializa sus pollos en los mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela ya establecida que la buscan por los buenos precio, por la amabilidad y el buen trato que le da a sus clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña cruz está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 50 pollos, concentrado para engordarlos y vitaminas, para luego salir a comercializarlos y así obtener mejores ganancias y podrá seguirle dando a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Cruz lives humbly with her husband and children in her own house.  Her husband works in construction near their place of residence and for several years now she’s worked raising chicks to fatten them up.  She sells the chickens in markets located near her place of residence.  She has many regular customers who seek her out because of her good prices, her kindness and the good service she provides her customers.  She uses what she earns from her sales to help her husband cover some of the household expenses.

Cruz is asking for a loan to buy 50 chicks, feed concentrate to fatten them up and vitamins to subsequently go out to sell them thus earning higher profits to continue giving her family what they need with no limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: top buy 50 chicks, feed concentrate and vitamins.

loans.name: Antonieta Yanet

texts.es: La socia continua con el negocio de venta de golosinas, con brindar servicio de llamadas y con la  confeccionan de muebles, ella junto con su familia trabajan  en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las golosinas, caramelos y galletas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar caramelos y galletas.
texts.en: The client continues with her business selling sweets, with providing calling services and with manufacturing furniture.  She and her family work in this business and they do very well.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell the snacks, candy and cookies.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy candy and cookies.

loans.use: to buy candy and cookies.

loans.name: Blaise Constant

texts.fr: Blaise est un jeune homme de 33 ans chef de famille ayant des enfants en charge. il fait dans la vente des chaussures dans un marché de la place. au regard de la petitesse de son capital, il est confronté régulièrement aux problème de rupture de stock. raison pour laquelle ilsollicite un crédit pour augmenter le stock de sa marchandise afin de mieux gérer son petit commerce et de se  faire des bénéfices. lesquelles lui permettront de de faire grandir son activité et de s'occuper de sa petite famille. à la longue il a un projet de construction d'une maison familiale.
texts.en: Blaise is 33 years old.  He has a family and a few children in his care.  He is involved in shoe sales at a local market.  Because of his small capital, he is often out-of-stock.  He is therefore taking a loan to increase his stock of shoes, which will help him to better manage his small retail business and make some profits.  These profits will help him to grow his business and to take care of his family.  In the long term, he plans to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of shoes.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 47 years old and married to Mary. They have six children who are in school.

Francis has a carpentry business in Naivasha, which he has operated for one year. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him to buy timber for his business. He intends to pay school fees with the anticipated profit.

In the near future, he hopes to own the biggest workshop in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Aliriam Del Carmen

texts.es: Aliriam es una mujer de 49 años de edad, madre de dos hijos y cabeza de hogar. Actualmente se dedica a manejar una guardería del ICBF, es madre comunitaria y además alterna su empleo, con la venta de productos por catálogo y mercancía por encargo, de esta manera ha logrado generar los ingresos suficientes para sacar adelante a sus hijos y para solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar, pues toda la carga económica recae sobre ella luego de la separación con su esposo. La cliente es una mujer organizada, activa, emprendedora y lucha incansablemente para seguir avanzando y velar por el bienestar de su familia. Se encuentra solicitando el crédito porque desea comprar una vitrina para exhibir los productos y surtido al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, cosméticos, accesorios de bisutería), con el fin de aprovechar los descuentos que obtiene y así aumentar el margen de ganancias, además tendrá disponibilidad de inventario para satisfacer los diferentes gustos de sus clientes. Esto le dará la oportunidad de seguir generando recursos para brindar estabilidad económica y bienestar a su familia, además tendrá la posibilidad de invertir en su negocio y fortalecerlo para que sea rentable y perdure en el tiempo.
texts.en:
Aliriam, 49, is a female head of household and mother of two children.  She currently manages an ICBF [Instituto Colombiano de Bienestar Familiar - Colombian Institute of Family Well-being] child care center; she’s a community mother and also alternates this with her job selling merchandise to order via catalog.  She’s succeeded in generating enough income this way to move her children forward and to cover basic household needs since the entire economic responsibility for her home is on her shoulders since her separation from her husband.

She’s an organized, active, enterprising woman who strives tirelessly to continue making progress and watching over her family’s well-being.  She’s requesting the loan because she wants to buy a display case to exhibit her goods and to buy stock at wholesale (perfumery, body creams, cosmetics, costume jewelry) to take advantage of available discounts thus increasing her profit margin.  In addition, she’ll have inventory on-hand to meet customers’ various tastes which will give her the opportunity of generating resources to provide economic stability and well-being for her family.  She will also be able to invest in her business and strengthen it so that it will be profitable and long-lasting.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and a display case.

loans.name: Mehwish

texts.en:
Mehwish is 24 years old and married.  She has two children.  She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small industry. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

She started her business to contribute to the family income. She has been in the business of sewing clothes for many years. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation, and she has gained a lot of appreciation in her community.  

Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with packs of buttons, needles, and elastic material. So then she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.  

Mehwish hopes to grow her business, and she dreams of giving a good quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, along with buttons, needles, and elastic material.

loans.name: Doris Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doris de 30 años de edad, culmino sus estudios de bachillerato, gracias a sus padres que le dieron la importancia de que se preparara académicamente,  madre soltera de un hijo de 9 años el cual esta estudiando cuarto grado, actualmente vive con sus padres 

Se dedica a la venta de ropa  por docena, ya tiene seis años de dedicarse al negocio, decidió iniciar su propio negocio, después de tener la experiencia de trabajar en una distribuidora de ropa; de ahí le nació la idea de instalar su propio negocio. 

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar mucha mas mercadería ropa de más variedad y tallas;  ya que este tiempo atrás venia comerciando con poco dinero, pero ahora el negocio va creciendo tiene mucha mas clientela que le demanda mas mercadería y por lo cual con este capital del crédito solicitado podrá abastecer a esos clientes y brindares un mejor servicio

A futuro, así como ve las cosas que el negocio va para arriba, quiere con esas ganancias poner su propia distribuidora y ser una de las principales distribuidoras de la zona, y que sus hijo se gradué de la universidad para que pueda ayudarle con la administración del negocio, además ella planea en un futuro muy corto encontrar pareja y brindarle una familia a su hijo.
texts.en:
Doris, 30, completed high-school thanks to her parents who made academic preparation a priority.  She’s currently living with her parents and she’s a single mother of a nine-year-old son who is in fourth grade.

She works selling clothes by the dozen.  She’s been in business six years.  She decided to start her own business after gaining experience working in a clothing supplier.  The idea for a business of her own was born there.

The loan will be used to buy much more clothing in a variety of styles and sizes because up to now she’s been selling with very little money but now the business has been growing and she has many more customers now and demand for clothes is growing so with the capital from the requested loan she’ll be able to satisfy said customers and provide them with better service.

In future, seeing that the business is heading upwards, she wants to use profits to open her own distributorship and become one of the main distributors in the zone.  Also, that her son graduates from university so that he can help her manage the business.  She also plans in the very near future to find a spouse to provide her son with a family.

loans.use: to buy much more variety of clothes in assorted sizes.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es: Liz, de 28 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, muy trabajadora y con deseos de superación, convive con Segundo con quien tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 4 años, vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia el cual construyó en base a mucho esfuerzo y constancia. La actividad que realiza Liz es la venta de carnes. Diariamente acude al mercado para obtener diversos productos comestibles como pollo, pescados, carne de res y carne de chancho. Realiza su trabajo en el frontis de su vivienda, ahí instala una mesa para exhibir todas las carnes que tiene para preparar diversos potajes del menú diario de sus clientes. Lleva en este negocio 1 año. Considera que su actividad es muy rentable por las buenas ganancias económicas que obtiene al finalizar el día ya que siempre logra vender absolutamente todo lo que ofrece. Eventualmente trabaja vendiendo frutas y productos regionales como aguajes y plátanos. La necesidad de cubrir las carencias económicas en su casa la llevaron a desarrollar este trabajo y algunas veces le resulta muy agotador. Sin embargo, espera continuar con su negocio ya que es su única fuente de ingreso. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 900, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado comprará pescados, pollos y carne de cerdo para continuar vendiendo en su puesto.
texts.en:
Liz, 28, is an enterprising, very hardworking woman who wants to improve.  She lives with Segundo with whom she has two children who are 8 and 4 years old.  She lives with her entire family in a house of her own she built thanks to much effort and constancy.  

Liz’s activity is selling meat.  She heads to the market daily to obtain various food items like chicken, fish, beef and pork.  She does her work in her front yard setting up a table there to display all the meats she has available for customers’ daily food preparation.

She’s been in business a year and considers it to be very profitable because of the good profits she nets at the end of the day since she always manages to sell absolutely everything she has on sale.  Occasionally she also goes from place to place selling fruit and regional products like ‘aguaje’ [tropical Amazonian fruit] and bananas.

She was led to this work by the need to cover her home’s economic needs and sometimes it’s exhausting.  However, she hopes to continue with her business because it’s her only source of income.

On this occasion she’s going to request 900 soles and she thanks all those people who make the financing possible for her to reach her goals.  She will use the requested amount to buy fish, chicken and pork to continue selling in her stand.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of two. 

She has been doing the business of tailoring for the past two years to support her husband.  She accepts the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now Asma has requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of buttons and laces. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

Asma hopes to grow her business, and she dreams of giving a good quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, along with packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a very hard-working woman and the mother of three children.  She lives in her own house with neither electricity nor piped water. 

Gladys makes various foods like chips, groundnuts, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cites seasonality as her major business challenge.

With the KES 15,000, she plans to purchase potatoes, wheat flour, and cooking oil. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. 

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of selling milk.  She has been doing this for many years, and she has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of the Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.  Currently she has two buffaloes, and now she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to buy another buffalo. 

This will help her increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her 6th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Jhosep

texts.es: Jhosep, de 26 años es un joven padre de familia, trabajador e independiente. Vive en compañía de su esposa Sonia y su hija, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 2 años. Jhosep se dedica a la agricultuta, desde pequeño aprendió del campo, es por esa razón que todos los días desde muy temprano cuida sus tierras, tiene 6 años de experiencia en el negocio, ahí aprendió a cuidar los sembríos su especialidad es el zapallo de buena calidad, pues el los nutre con abono orgánico. En la actualidad tiene 4 hectáreas de sembrío y desea seguir sembrando más, pues espera de este año una buena temporada. “La agricultura es poco difícil, se tiene que esperar varios meses para tener ganancias, por esa razón comencé en el negocio de compra y venta de ganado en especial de toros de toda calidad y tamaño”, afirma. Ahora espera poder incrementar su ganadería, aumento la crianza de animales menores, ya que en la venta de animales obtiene ganancias diarias. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, esta muy contento de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos. Jhosep, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Jhosep, 26, is a young, independent, hardworking father living with his wife, Sonia, and their daughter who he cares for in the house he bought two years ago.  Jhosep works in agriculture.  He learned to work in the fields when still a child and this is why he heads out to care for his land every day very early.   He has six years’ experience in this business and has learned how to care for his crops, especially good quality pumpkins that he nourishes with organic manure.

He currently has four hectares in cultivation and he wants to continue planting more because he’s hoping for a good season this year.  “Agriculture is a bit difficult; one has to wait several months to earn profits.  This is why I started the business of buying and selling cattle, especially all types and sizes of bulls,” he states.  He now hopes to increase his herd size and to increase the number of small animals because he earns good daily profits selling animals.

This is his second Kiva loan and he’s very happy to have financial support since he’s always shown himself to be responsible with his payments.  Jhosep will use the money to buy organic manure for his crop.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado de su municipio, es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta siempre está buscando la manera de poder ayudar a su familia en los gastos de la casa, por esa razón decidió poner su negocio, tiene mucha clientela que la buscas porque sus productos son muy frescos, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de papas, ejotes, tomates, güisquiles, pipianes, melocotones, frijoles, etc. para poder tener más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes y así obtener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando a su familia en lo que necesiten sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: This client lives with her family in her own house.  For the last three years she’s been selling fruit and vegetables in the town market.  She’s a hardworking, responsible, honest person who is always looking for ways to help her family with household expenses.  Because of this she decided to open her own business.  She has many customers that seek her out because her products are very fresh.  She’s asking for a loan to buy potatoes, green beans, tomatoes, chayote, pumpkins, peaches, beans, etc. to have more merchandise on-hand to offer customers thus earning higher profits and continuing to help her family with everything they need with no limits whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña Ana  vive en casa propia, junto a su compañero de vida y a sus hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, chile y tomate,  es una persona humilde, dedicada, responsable, además muy trabajadora con ganas de sacar su familia adelante, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía. Doña Ana solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de  etc. y de esta manera  Incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own house with her life companion and their children.   She works growing corn, chilies and tomatoes.  She’s a humble, dedicated, responsible and hardworking person who very much wants to move her family forward.  Thanks to her work she’s been able to cover many of her family expenses.  When the harvest is in she stores it in the silos shown in the photo.

Ana’s asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, manure, fertilizer, herbicide, pest control, etc. to increase income and improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María Luisa continua con su actividad comercial que es la venta de tejidos como chompas, bufandas, guantes, gorros etc, ella continua vendiendo sus productos en uno de los mercados artesanales más importantes de la ciudad. En esta oportunidad requiere el prestamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo  chompas, ponchos y bufandas. Ella está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. 

María Luisa pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
María Luisa continues with her commercial activity which is selling woven clothes like sweaters, ponchos, scarves, gloves, caps, etc.  She continues selling her goods in one of the city’s most important crafts markets.

On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise like sweaters, ponchos and scarves, for example.  She’s very grateful to lenders for helping her develop in her work and commits to continue making her payments punctually.  María Luisa belongs to the “Kukuli” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like sweaters, ponchos and scarves.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa de un familiar, junto a sus padres y hermanos, él se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de arroz y maíz, es una persona con objetivos y con metas claras,  la responsabilidad y esfuerzo hacen de él una persona distinguida, gracias a su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de su padre ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de arroz como fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para continuar con esta labor que ha sacado adelante hasta este momento a su familia, incrementar sus ingresos  y darle a su familia un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
This client lives with his parents and siblings in a relative’s house.  He works in agriculture mainly growing rice and corn.  He’s a person with clear goals and objectives.  Responsibility and effort makes him stand out.  Thanks to his effort and with his father’s help he’s managed to cover many of his costs.

He’s asking for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like fertilizer, manure, herbicide, pest control, etc. for his rice crop to continue with this work that has supported his family to date, to increase his income and to give his family an economically stable future.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 42-year-old vigorous lady and the mother of five children. 

She has been stitching clothes for many years to contribute to the family income.  Her husband works as a driver whose income is insufficient to meet their household expenses alone. 

Shameem stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 frrom the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.  

All that will give her a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Leonor Gioconda

texts.es:
La socia Leonor continua con la comercialización de ropa para damas, actividad que realiza de manera directa y a solicitud de su clientela. En esta oportundiad requiere el prestamo para comprar mercadería como vestidos y accesorios como carteras, correas y bufandas, para capitalizar su negocio y cumplir con las solicitudes de sus clientas.

La socia está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por ayudarla en el fortalecimiento de su actividad y por permitirle procurarles una mejor educación a sus hijos los cuales están en edad escolar.
texts.en: Leonor continues selling women’s clothes, an activity she does directly and to customer request.  On this occasion she needs the loan to buy merchandise like dresses and accessories like purses, belts and scarves to capitalize her business and fill customer orders.  She’s very grateful to lenders for helping her to strengthen her activity and for allowing her to provide better education for her children who are school age.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like dresses and accessories like purses, belts and scarves.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con sus padres y su hermano en casa propia, es una persona muy trabajadora, honesta y responsable, ella se dedica a la venta de cremas, perfumes, lociones, desodorantes, shampoo, etc. desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad y los buenos precios con que vende sus productos,  la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor y así surtir aun mas su negocio ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, así seguirá ayudando en los gasto que se le presentan en su hogar y podrá tener con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The client lives with her parents and her brother in her own house.  She is a very hard-working, honest, and responsible person.  She has been selling creams, perfumes, lotions, deodorants, and shampoo, etc. for several years.  Her business is located at her house.  She also sells in an itinerant manner in different neighborhoods.  She has a lot of clientele because of the quality and the good prices for which she sells her products.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise wholesale.  This way she will stock her business even more.  This is her only source of work.  This way she will continue helping with the household expenses, and she and her family with have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, lotions, deodorants, and shampoo, etc. wholesale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: La socia Ruth continúa con su actividad comercial de venta de productos de belleza como cosméticos y perfumería, alternando con la venta de suministros de cómputo como accesorios, hardware y software para equipos de cómputo, y los comercializa de forma directa y a solicitud de su clientela. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cosméticos y perfumes, ella está muy agradecida con los inversionistas por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su trabajo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Ruth continues to do her economic activity selling beauty products, such as cosmetics and perfume. She alternates this with selling computer supplies such as accessories, hardware, and computers. She sells directly and to order. At this time, she needs the loan to buy cosmetics and perfumes. She is very grateful to the investors for allowing her to develop in her work and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfume.

loans.name: Esther Marina

texts.es:
Esther, es una persona trabajadora y vive con su familia, solo con sus hijos, ya que es madre soltera, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. Ella, posee una tienda para obtener ingresos para el hogar, dicha actividad lo aprendió de familia y lo realiza de lunes a domingo de 6:00am a 8:00pm, ventaja con el negocio que lo tiene en su casa.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar variedad de productos, tales como: azúcar, arroz, frijoles, sal, bebidas, detergentes, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a ofrecerle una mayor atención a los clientes con la mercadería y adquirir mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es construir más en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Esther’s a hardworking woman living with her family consisting of just her children for she’s a single mother.  She has no relatives abroad.  She has a store to earn household income having learned said activity from her family.  She works Monday to Sunday from 6am to 8pm.  Her advantage is that the store is home-based.

She requests the loan to buy a variety of products like sugar, rice, beans, salt, beverages and detergent, among others.  This investment will help her offer wider variety and better customer service and to earn higher income.  Her dream is to build on to her house.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su familia, desde hace varios años se dedica a al cultivo de elotes, rábanos y ejotes, tiene mucha clientela que lo busca por los buenos precios, los productos son frescos y el tiene una buena amabilidad cuando le llegan a comprar, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. y seguir con sus cosechas como hasta ahora para obtener mejores ganancias y seguirle ayudando a su familia para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: This client lives in his own home and for several years has grown corn, radishes, and green beans. He has a lot of customers who seek him out for the good prices, the fresh products, and his friendly manner when they go to buy from him. With what he earns from his sales, he pays for some household expenses. He is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, pest control, etc. to continue with his crops and continue to obtain profits and keep helping his family for more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо 41 года. Она замужем на доброго человека, которого зовут Фархад. Он предприниматель. Дилрабо всегда мечтала, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. В этом году ее дочь Дилдора окончила среднюю школу и поступила в Худжандский Государственный Университет в факультет Русская филология. Они живут в сельской местности. В их районе существует проблема нехватки учителей русского языка. Многие дети не владеют русским языком. Дилрабо хочет, чтобы ее дочь была высококвалифицированной учительницей русского языка. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своей дочери, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора своей дочери в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilrabo is 41 years old. She is married to a good man, whose name is Farhad. He is an entrepreneur. Dilrabo has always dreamed that her children would receive a higher education. This year, her daughter Dildora graduated from high school and enrolled in Khujand State University in the Faculty of Russian Philology. They live in a rural area. Their neighborhood has a shortage of Russian teachers. Many children do not speak Russian. Dilrabo wants her daughter to become a highly skilled Russian teacher. She has to pay her daughter's tuition, but has no money. She has requested a loan to pay for her daughter's tuition at the university. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for education of her daughter

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es: José, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Lempira. José siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, desde pequeño ha trabajado con su padre. Tiene 15 años de tener su propia finca de café, siendo su fuente de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. La producción que saca la vende en el mercado local. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 25,000 lempiras para comprar los fertilizantes y darle mantenimiento a su finca y sacar mejores cosechas. Su meta es comprar un terreno para sembrar mas café.
texts.en:
José, 36, is married with five children and lives in a village in the municipality of Lempira.  José has always worked in agriculture; he worked alongside his father when still little.  He’s had his own coffee grove for 15 years and it’s his source of income for family support.  He sells his crop in the local market. 

He’s decided to request a 25,000 Lempira loan to buy fertilizer to provide crop maintenance to yield the best harvest.  His goal is to buy land to plant more coffee.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Ana Flora

texts.es:
Ana Flora, es una mujer de 58 años, madre de cinco hijos, ya tres de ellos son independientes.
Ella con su negocio que comenzó hace más de 10 años, logró dar educación a sus hijos, mejorar su vivienda y mantenerse en el negocio , creciendo como persona como mujer independiente, empoderada ya que toma sus decisiones y asume responsablemente sus implicaciones. Ella es una mujer con visión , va modificando sus productos según las necesidades y demandas del mercado.
Es solidaria con otras mujeres a las cuales las motiva a ser creativas, forjarse metas y aconseja para que mejoren su calidad de vida y sus negocios.
Ella ha mantenido una muy buena relación crediticia con la fundación, también le interesa capacitarse en gestión y manejo del negocio y formación humana.
Apoya a su hija mayor con el cuido de los niños y también apoyándola en el desarrollo de sus habilidades  en producción de artículos que vende en su negocio o bazar.
El préstamo le  permitirá mejorar producción al poder contar con nueva tecnología o maquinaria , que le mejorará el diseño de sus productos.
texts.en:
Ana Flora, 58, is mother of five children three of whom are independent now.  She started her business more than ten years ago and has managed with it to school her children, make home improvements and to stay in business growing as an independent, empowered woman who makes her own decisions and responsibly assumes their implications.  She’s a woman with vision who modifies her products according to market need and demand.  She’s supportive of other women and motivates them to be creative, to set goals and advises them so that they can improve their quality of life and improve their businesses.

She has maintained a very good credit history with the Fundación and she’s also interested in becoming proficient in business affairs and management and in human development.

She helps care for her oldest daughter’s children and also helps her to develop her skills in producing the items she sells in her business or in the bazaar.  The loan will help her improve production by having new technology or machinery that will improve her product design.

loans.use: to buy a machine to make felt and foam patterns and to buy raw materials.

loans.name: El Aguila De Caquil Group

texts.es:
El señor Mario Antonio es unido de hecho, tiene 44, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 4 hijos y de ellos 2 estan estudiando, se dedica a la crianza de animales domesticos, iniciò este negocio comprando un cerdtio y una cabra, hasta la fecha lleva 25 años de experiencia. 

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prestamo que lo utilizarà para la compra de cerdos y cabras, en el futuro espera tener un buen capital de trabajo para aumentar sus ganancias. Los demas integrantes del grupo se dedican a la crianza de animales domèstico.
texts.en: Mario Antonio is 44 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He has four children, two of whom study. He did not have the opportunity to study. He raises domestic animals. He started this business buying one pig and a goat. He now has 25 years of experience. He organized a group and requested a loan that he will use to buy pigs and goats. In the future he hopes to have more working capital to increase his income. The other members of the group also raise domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and goats.

loans.name: Patrina

texts.ru: Патрина 38-летняя замужняя женщина, проживает с мужем и детьми в городе Кургантюбе Хатлонской области. Патрина на дому работает няней. Сейчас она присматривает за двумя детьми и получает за это в месяц 100 долларов. Ее муж в данный момент безработный. Чтобы улучшить финансовое положение семьи Патрина хочет помочь мужу и обеспечить его работой. Она просит кредит для покупки мотороллера. Ее муж будет работать на центральном рынке и предоставлять услуги по перевозке товара. Это достаточно прибыльный бизнес. У них имеется сбережение в размере 3000 таджикских сомони. С помощью кредита Патрина сможет приобрести мотороллер, а ее муж начать зарабатывать. Они ждут вашей помощи.
texts.en: Patrina is a 38-year-old married woman who lives with her ​​husband and children in the city of Kurgan Khatlon. Patrina works as a nanny. She is looking after two children and receives a $ 100 per month. Her husband is currently unemployed. Patrina wants to help her husband to find work in order to improve the financial situation of the family. She has requested a loan to buy a scooter. Her husband will be working at the central market and provide services for the transport of goods. This is a rather profitable business. They have 3,000 TJS saved up. With the help of a loan, Patrina will be able to buy a scooter, and her husband will be able to start earning money. They are waiting for your help.

loans.use: To purchase a scooter in order to provide transportation services for goods

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 44 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Edgar, con quien tuvo 5 hijos, a los que cuida en la casa que heredó de su madre . Victoria es una mujer trabajadora, junto a su esposo se dedica al cuidado de su ganado, cuenta que posee toros, vacas y ovejas en cantidad. Pero su principal ingreso económico se centra en el bordado de faldas típicas, de diversos colores y texturas, los cuales vende a diversos comerciantes que llegan a su misma casa para negociarlos, comenta que en épocas de festividades como es “el santiago”, festividad en honor a los animales; vende más faldas y tiene más pedidos. Ahora ella se encuentra trabajando con mucho esfuerzo pues es en esta época donde tiene mayor ingreso, “espero aprovechar el máximo para obtener las ganancias que espero”, comenta muy contenta. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo que le brindaron, pues podrá seguir invirtiendo en el progreso de su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Victoria, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de telas de diferentes colores para su bordado.
texts.en:
Victoria is 44 years old and lives with her husband, Edgar, and their five children in a home that she inherited from her mother. Victoria is a hard-working woman who takes care of livestock with her husband. She says that they have bulls, cows and a large number of sheep. But her principal source of income is from selling traditional skirts, which she embroiders in a wide range of colors and textures. 

Victoria sells her embroidery work to a diverse group of merchants who come to do business with her. She says that during holidays, such as “el Santiago,” she receives more orders and sells more skirts. Victoria works very hard during this season because it is when she makes the most money. She says very happily, “I am expecting to really take advantage of it to make the profit I am hoping for.”  

This is Victoria’s second Kiva loan. She says that she is grateful to lenders for the help, because she will be able to continue investing to move ahead with her business. Victoria will use the loan to buy different colored fabrics for her embroidery work.

loans.use: to buy different colored fabrics for her embroidery work.

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Hilda de 60 años de edad vive en casa alquilada desde hace 10 años  vive con sus dos hijos quienes trabajan y le ayudan en los gastos del hogar, desde hace varios años posee un tienda en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues tienen la tienda muy surtida, vende sus productos a buen precio y es muy amable con sus clientes cuando le llegan a comprar, doña Hilda está solicitando un crédito para la compra de azúcar, granos básicos, sopas, refrescos, golosinas, etc. para surtir aun mas su tienda, y así obtener mejores ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica junto a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Hilda is 60 years old. She has lived in a rented house for the past ten years with her two children, who work and contribute to the household expenses. She has had a store in her house for the last few years. She has lots of customers as the store is well stocked. She sells at a fair price and she is very friendly with the customers when they come to shop.

Hilda is requesting a loan to buy sugar, basic grains, soup, soft drinks, candy etc. to stock her store more and generate more income. This would give her and her children greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy sugar, basic grains, soup, soft drinks, candy etc.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехра добросовестная женщина. Ей 41 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети Голиб, Олим и Дурдона еще не имеют источника дохода. Ее муж Рустам занимается выращиванием лука и пшеницы. Гулчехра в течение 15 лет занимается скотоводством. Она имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу. Гулчехра откармливает скот несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке по более высокой цене, чем она приобрела. Гулчехра хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние и не отвечает стандартам жилья. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Gulchehra is an honest, conscientious woman. She is 41 years old. She is married and raising 3 children. Her children, Golib, Olim and Durdona, still do not have a source of income. Her husband Rustam grows onions and wheat. Gulchehra has over 15 years of experience in animal husbandry. She has a great deal of experience in this business. Gulchehra fattens cattle for several months and then sells them on the local market at a higher price. Gulchehra wants to renovate her house, because her house is in poor condition and is not up to living standards. She has requested a loan of 6500 TJS for the purchase of construction materials such as cement, wood, and so forth. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair her house

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is married and the mother of one child, who is in school. She lives in her own house, which has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Purity operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and villagers. Her greatest challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Purity joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Carine Félicité

texts.fr: carine est une femme de 33 ans, célibataire et mère de deux enfants. elle possède et gère un mini restaurant dans un quartier de la ville où elle fait des repas camerounais depuis 1 an et demi. elle sollicite ce nouveau crédit pour augmenter son stock de matières premières afin d'accroître son chiffre d'affaires et son profit. les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d'augmenter son capital d'une part et d'autre part de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Carine is 33 years old, unmarried, and the mother of two children. She owns and manages a mini-restaurant in a district of the city where she has been making Cameroonian food for a year and a half.
